Reviews.Title: “SUPER CLEAN, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amandaconway85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from New York and we had the best experience at the Mayfair. The hotel was older, but was cutely decorated and had a lot of character. The room was small, but was extremely functional (cabinets, closet, and cubbie holes to store luggage). The room and bathroom were spotless! The location was amazing as well. It is half a block from Times Square (a couple minute walk) and the Book of Morman play was right next door. The staff was nice and helpful. Such a great value and location! I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and site”
Reviews.Author: hausl
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location if you're off to a broadway play. The room is small but clean and quiet. Staff are friendly. Great place for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: erin464
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us into this hotel for our anniversary trip, and I absolutely loved it. It was in a great location - within steps of the subway, and many restaurants and coffee shops, and within 5 minutes of Times Square. This made it so easy to get around! It is also conveniently located beside the theater where The Book of Mormon is playing - that came in handy, since all we had to do is walk out the door to the hotel and we were in our seats in the theater in minutes. The reviews are correct that the rooms are VERY small. However, I found our room to be fully functional. The bathroom was huge - we had no problems getting ready together. Also, all the built-ins helped maximize space. When I saw pictures of the decor in the rooms I had my doubts, but I found myself totally charmed when I saw it in person. It's definitely not the decor of your average boring hotel room, with the matching patterned wall paper, bedspread, headboard, and curtains! Our view wasn't great - we seemed to look out onto this dark courtyard space between the two sides of the building, but I actually kind of loved being able to look out and see the pigeons out there. I think they could probably stand to upgrade the TVs they have in their rooms, but on the other hand, I'm not even sure the rooms could fit bigger flat screen TVs! This was my third time in NYC and this was by far the best hotel I've stayed in on my budget. I will recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: Douglas S
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be a bit old but it's clean and the staff is nice. The best part is location. It's located in the heart of the city near many popular theaters. Also, there is a piano in the lobby for public use. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “No Heat!”
Reviews.Author: lelabella
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, worn but very charming! I booked two rooms one for my 75 year old Mother and one for myself. Unfortunately my Mothers room had no heat and it happened to be the coldest weekend this winter. I complained late in the evening and was assured the heat would be fixed. The next morning she told me she had no heat all night! She has cancer! I felt terrible and told the front desk. We checked out and when I later called the Manager would not speak with me or compensate me for the room! Very disappointing! The location is great for Theatre. St. Malachy's The Actors Chapel is directly across the street. Walkable from Port Authority.

Reviews.Title: “We knew what to expect - so it was a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: RN4Little1s
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor reviews, we had a good idea of what we were getting into at thos hotel. This was my first trip to NYC, my husband's 2nd. We wanted to be near Times Square, but found the prices of most hotels out of our budget. We stayed 4 nights, arriving on a Thursday and leaving on a Monday. Our room was tiny, but again we expected that. My husband is 6'4 and could touch both walls of the room. The bathroom was big enough for one of us to get ready comfortably. There was a leak around the shower that caused a small puddle to develop - we threw a towel on it. There was a nice sized flat screen TV - we watched SNL on Saturday while Jimmy Fallon was there, which was fun! We were on the 4th floor - that elevator is VERY tiny. So if you would like to avoid it altogether, ask for a lower level floor. The location is the best! When we wanted Starbucks, we popped out of our hotel and walked down 2 blocks to the one on Times Square! When we went out to see Wicked on Broadway our first night there, we just waltzed down the street to the Gerschwin. We took a short walk to Central Park one day, and a longer warlk down 5th Ave. another day. Loved it. We were in the middle of it all, sort of tucked away in this little hotel that I considered to give us the full "New York" experience. Among all my hotel experiences this would be a 3 star, but for its value in a high pricey area where I didn't feel we missed out on anything by choosing and saving money, I give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “UyIn the heart of it all..clean and just right”
Reviews.Author: kody76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. Simple, quiet,clean and pretty....price averaged 96.00 a night...just perfect location, rooms cleaned everyday, nice staff, safe, room was decent size for NYC, honestly found the place we will always stay..really should b rated higher, only negative thing was the elevator needs a face lift.other then that just a nice perfect cute hotel in the heart of it all

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellente location”
Reviews.Author: Car035
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel for five days. I arrived at 10 am and my room was ready and waiting for me, which was very nice after a long trip. Location is the main asset of this place. My room was tiny but had everything I could need, and everything was clean and tidy. The main drawback was the noise of the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and nice”
Reviews.Author: ragnlunatic
Reviews.Content: Yes, I was a bit reluctant to try this place since I read the negative reviews but decided to live on the edge and try it out anyways....especially since my other choice sold out and ALL hotels have their fair share of negative reviews. Overall, I am glad we stayed here. For off broadway shows, this was VERY close to many theaters (two doors down from one of them). Just about everything was walking distance, especially some 'big ticket' items such as Rockefeller Center, Times Square (we only wandered what seemed to be a couple blocks and looked up and realized we were in the middle of Times Square), Hard Rock, etc. We walked to Macy's and the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings though they are a bit further of a walk.To get to Battery Park/Castle Clinton/South Ferry which gets you to the Statue of Liberty, we took the 1 subway and the entrance was a block up and a block over from the hotel and took us right to the South Ferry in less than 1/2 hour. It was very convenient. Now for the hotel...it served its purpose. The room with 1 queen bed was sufficient - not big, but we weren't fighting each other for space. They even fit a small table, chair and settee that I believe could have been unfolded and used as a single sleeper. There was some dark spots in the corners of the shower and the mirror was cracked. This may sound nightmarish, but it really wasn't. The hair dryer in the room didn't work but within 15 minutes of reporting it, someone came to the room and replaced it. As with many places in NY, the hotel was old and you could tell, but it didn't give us the heebie jeebies. The lobby was nice, the hotel was clean and the staff was extremely nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly,great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Olympia_Deb
Reviews.Content: We checked out of the Doubletree Metropolitan and into the Mayfair for our last night in New York. So glad we did! The price was excellent for a small room with queen sized bed and ensuite bathroom. I loved the wood paneled walls, the creaky old elevator, and the sweet coordinated wallpaper. The location was right in the center of the Theatre District but not loud at all. Only quibble is that the bed was too soft. After a few days I might have a bit of a back problem.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! Book it now!”
Reviews.Author: suzzyf
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to the Mayfair, but my first since the remodel. We booked a queen bed and it was glorious! Stayed in 3 other hotels on this trip, and this bed was the best AND the least expensive. Fab location great service will B back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: karen d
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a premiere with my teen daughter. From the minute we entered, staff made us feel right at home. They gave us directions, hailed cabs for us and stored our luggage for a couple of bucks. The rooms are tiny, but cute and cozy. Nothing beats the location -- close to everything, but still quiet, We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location so close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: sukit87
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 4 nights recently and you cannot ask for a better location. It was so close to Times Square. The room was very small but clean, the bed was comfortable. There was a computer in the room that didn't work but the wifi worked fine and there is a computer in the lobby with a printer for guests. There wasn't a fridge in the room which i thought was odd but i haven't never been to NY before so this may be the norm. Overall great hotel for the price i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but clean”
Reviews.Author: KQQ
Reviews.Content: the Rooms are SUPER tiny (almost no place to even put your luggage) but it was clean and all you need. GREAT location, literally in the middle of everything. The people were friendly that worked there. It's a little ghetto but not in a bad way. I would definatly recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfrompnwest
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 4 nights at the Mayfair (October 2011). I would not stay again - however, this hotel is probably a good option for some. If you are from Europe (especially Eastern Europe) and want an affordable tourist class hotel in Mid-town - you probably will like this place. I have traveled a lot in Europe, the Middle East and Africa and I have a high tolerance for un-impressive hotels. This hotel is similar to what I would expect from a budget hotel in London or Paris (though I would expect those properties to be more clean). When I travel in the US, I have different expectations. First - the good. 1. Location, location and location. The spot is perfect for tourist wanting to explore time sq, walk to central park or shop Harold Sq. It is close to metro stops, small grocery stores for an affordable meal, and near deli's and pizza places. 2. The price. I paid $250 per night - it is nearly impossible to find something else for this rate in mid-town. 3. The staff. Other reviews have stated the staff were rude and wanted lots of tips. I did not deal with the staff much, but when I did, I found them to be nice and helpful. I did not tip any of the hotel staff at anytime and no one ever hinted that they expected a tip (I did leave a tip for the maid, but I did this without being asked and because I felt bad for the maid staff as they clearly work very hard). The Bad (why I would not go back): 1. The room is just really too small. Luckily I only had one small bag, so I was able to make the room work. But most Americans travel with large bags and I don't know where I would have put my bag if I had brought a larger bag with me. 2. There was really no window within the room. Technically, there is a window, but it looks out onto a brick wall a few feet away. So, there is little to no natural light. There is also no way to circulate any air into the small room other than through a window shaker AC unit. The AC unit made a ton of noise and filled the room with the smell of urine when it was raining (my guess is that people are urinating in the alley below and the rain is activating the urine smell which the AC unit is then pulling into the room. When it was not raining the AC unit was fine, but when it rained I could not tolerate the smell and had to turn it off). 3. The room and hallways are dirty. This is the issue that will keep me away. I found it difficult to determine if my feeling that the hotel was dirty was based on the fact that the hotel is very worn down or if it was actually unclean. I am still not sure which is correct and my best guess is that it is a combination of the two. The carpets are worn and stained, the wall paper is torn and stained, the floors are uneven, there are random holes in the ceilings (not in my room, but in hallways and elevator). I don't know how a hotel cannot plan to replace its carpet and wallpaper/paint every 2 to 3 years - having people coming and going requires an investment in the property year after year and the owners have neglected the property for too long. I do think the maid service worked really hard to try and clean the place, but there is only so much they can do. If you can't afford $50.00 more per night for better hotel options than you can probably make this place work, but if you can swing spending a little more, I would, and I will.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair Hotel near Times Sq.”
Reviews.Author: VadimBelousov
Reviews.Content: Typical hotel, just at the center of Theater District, 100 m away from Times Sq. and Broadway. Some subway stations of diff. lines are also on 2-3 minutes by step. Rooms are tiny, just a narrow pass around the bed. Free Internet access via 2 computers at the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sundew_Girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights-Mid Sept 2011. Tiny room, tiniest lift ever seen. The hotel is outdated and rooms are tired. But you're in NYC and we were tourists there, so were out most of the time. Feels really cramped in the beginning, but then you get used to it. Room had a window, but was blocked by a wooden slab, so we had no clue if it was day or night and no access to the open windows.Closet space was only used to store our shopping bags. Make sure to carry a spare footware, as the floor mats are not really clean. Ac quite noisy. Hotel staff, friendly, but you need to tip them regularly. The hotel charges for maintenance service, fuel and surcharge which we found quite strange. So get the room cleaned everyday because you are pating for it. While checking-out, hotel staff will suggest you a taxi service from their end to the airport (ours JFK), we got a limo, but make sure to verify prices with the hotel and the driver before you board. Its usually $50 to JFK, but we believed what the hotel staff said and had a bit of haggling to do at the airport, as the driver said it was $65. Hotel so close to Times Square. Don't miss the Italian restaurant next to the hotel as you turn right at the exit, pricey, but really good. Wi-fi doesn't work in the room most of the time, but then you have a computer near the reception which you can use. Suggest this place if you prefer to stay close to Times square and not spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Mayfair Hotel New York”
Reviews.Author: sarah f
Reviews.Content: I found my stay in the Mayfair Hotel New York great the staff are soo helpful and the location is excellent its soo close to Times Square and everything else. Even though it was close we didnt hear anything rooms are nice and quiet. Rooms are a bit small but bathroom is a good size but its everything you need in a hotel which is so central. Loved it thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in a Mediocare hotel”
Reviews.Author: NavaSc
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel your heart falls down your middle: Inconspicuous entrance, 5 stairs to overcome with your luggage and a smallish, rundown reception. Elevator tiny and rundown. Luckily for us we have reserved a king size bed/room - it was big enough for 2! large and specious bathroom, not much closet space but we could live out of our suitcases. (had a glimpse into a regular room, it seemed a guest could either be on the bed or out the door..). The room and bathroom were extremely clean! Staff was friendly, funny and helpful 24/7. Location - amazing!. I would recommed this hotel, but feel that they charge TOO much for what its worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: BShaw010
Reviews.Content: The review title says it all. The location, within a couple of blocks of Times Square in the heart of Manhattan is fantastic. The room, however is not. I fully recognize that expectations must be realistic when thinking about staying in NYC, but $250/night for a 10x12 room that is dated is not acceptable. If you have to pay $300-$350 for a decent room in the area (I know they are available), do it!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Pub
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tiny but mighty. If you're used to cruise ships and Europe, the rooms will suit you just fine. Quite an affordable price for being so incredibly well-located. I would recommend to any experienced traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap place to stay in heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Doverkid
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Mayfair for years. You have to watch the prices but generally they are better than most other places. Expect no frills, small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: femalenomadtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is ridiculously overpriced and horrible. The room was extremely small and had non working central air conditioning. There was an ancient window unit crammed in a scary window that did not open, which looked out into a scary bates hotel type of shadowy outdoors. The hotel is so overpriced and barely tolerable. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Receptionist - Beatrice!”
Reviews.Author: ml648926
Reviews.Content: First off, I did not stay at this hotel, merely called to inquire on vacancy-unfortunately they were full for the october weekend I had in mind. The receptionist who took my call however deserves more than a mention- Beatrice. She was extremely friendly, polite and helpful notwithstanding that the hotel did not have the room configuration i wanted. After calling a few hotels in New York, the common impression I got was somewhat rude, not very helpful and even surly at times. However Beatrice from Mayfair was entirely different, what a pleasant surprise! Hope to stay here next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Juanff
Reviews.Content: This place is worth it because it's location, just 2 min away from Times Square, walking distance from Central Park. Rooms are very small but they are clean and in NYC you wonÂ´t spend much time inside your room ;) In my opinion this hotel is a bit expensive but again you are paying the location and it's NYC...

Reviews.Title: “You better be flexable...”
Reviews.Author: lambkee
Reviews.Content: Ok, here's the disclaimer. First time in NYC and I have no clue what a good deal may be. That being said you have to know what your in for with the Mayfair. Nice Front Desk, had no issue with them other than the A/C was out and it was HOT! The size of the Elevator gives you a clue as to the size of the room. They are cozy, (hence the flexable) but they are clean and your only sleeping there anyway, aren't you? Well you should be... It's nice and close to Time Square and Broadway, big plus. Now I have to mention the room Decor shall we say... Interesting.... It's almost an optical illusion of sorts. There is a "scene" depicted on the Wallpaper and it carries over on to the Curtains, Headboard, Bedspread, I could swear the Lamp Shades, and just about every other thing in the room. It's almost comical really. But it is clean and decent. Now what was a bit hard to swallow was the $270 a night price. Ouch! Once again, this could be Time Square reasonable I really don't know. Not a terrible place to stay in our opinion... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: brooke789
Reviews.Content: very affordable, very cute hotel. rooms were very small, but very charming! computer with internet in the room was very helpful. above all...LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION was great!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Location! Rooms kinda small but who cares! Price was great too!”
Reviews.Author: justfour
Reviews.Content: The location was 2 blocks from time square, rockafella center, 2 theatres were on our street if you wanted to go to see a show. The rooms where small but we did not stay in them long on the go! the front desk was nice and informative. When we arrived at the hotel early they stored our bags until we could check in that afternoon. And 2 days later at check out they stored our bags again until we left the city @ $5.00 a bag...(did not like that deal.) overall I will stay at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1946
Reviews.Content: We were put in a tiny room with a double bed because of a reservation error, but the suggested replacement was just as small but had a queen-sized bed. I think this is the smallest room I have ever been given anywhere in the world in 40 years of travel. Unlike their website description: "The guestrooms evoke a European style intimacy featuring custom designed mahogany furniture, freshly cut flowers and the finest and most comfortable bedding available," our room had essentially no furniture, certainly no flowers, roughly 9" from the edge of the bed to the wall. The bathroom had only a tiny sink with no place to put toiletries. The site also claims that it has a restaurant: "It's romantic restaurant, the Garrick, continues the theatrical theme. Named for the 17th century Shakespearean actor, David Garrick, the intimate dining room features classic cuisine reminiscent of the 1940's favorites and a popular three course Prix fixe pre-theater menu." But, the restaurant is long gone. They don't even offer hot coffee in the lobby. The attitude of the staff was dismissive and borderline rude. It's not the worst I have been treated anywhere--that would be in Rome--but, pretty darn close.

Reviews.Title: “Had a perfectly fine experience”
Reviews.Author: Czesc
Reviews.Content: I booked this place on Orbitz before I read the reviews here. I was a little concerned but after my three night stay, I have to say the hotel was just fine. Sure, it is OLD and the public areas of the building show it. My room was clean and neat and the bathroom was nicely remodeled with a shower that had excellent water pressure and hot water. I was on the third floor next to the elevator and never heard a sound. Yes, the room is cramped but this is NYC people; You shouldnt be spending so much time in your room anyway. You are in the heart of Times Square. There was a nice Samsung flat screen TV and nice A/C unit that cooled the room down quickly. My one ding would be that there was only WiFi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Dire!”
Reviews.Author: Kate4dance
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night en route to joining a cruise ship. It was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. My first room was tiny and was fine for me but as a double room not enough room for two people.However this was not an issue. First impression apart from the size was ok, however I was not alone as I was accompanied by a mouse emerging from the en suite. My immediate complaint was treated with an upgrade to another room. During the move however it was clear there was more than one mouse as the corridors revealed yet more of the scampering creatures. My upgraded room again initially looked ok but further investigation revealed bare wires hanging from the AC system. The fire alarm was hanging from the ceiling with the wires exposed and two of the concealed ceiling lights immediately above the pillows on the bed were unprotected. Wall lights were novel as they revolved 180 degrees and not fixed to the wall correctly. The bathroom wall lights were absolutely filthy with grease and dust and obviously had not seen a cloth in months. The 'mouse' saga had not ended as you could hear them scratching, on the floor above, in the skirting boards and goodness knows where throughout the night. There are absolutely no facilities for any refreshments, a pokey and unstable lift and stained wallpaper peeling off the walls on the staircases and corridors. The staff were amicable but not friendly.......images of the Bates Motel in Psycho......I didn't feel safe at all. Where was the Restaurant that was advertised? When I asked about somewhere for a cup of coffee or breakfast the following morning I was directed to a very 'seedy' looking cafe around the corner that looked equally as run down as the hotel. My bill was more than I initially signed for when I checked in.......along with the usual American taxes which I'm sure were inflated.....was wait for this....a fuel charge for heating and lighting. What! I refused to sign anything on check out expecting some sort of compensation for the discomfort I had endured during the overnight stay. They said I could contact the manager during the week to discuss the matter. Although I was at sea I made ship to shore calls but was told he was not on the premises. Expecting to negotiate a price before any money was taken from my bank account to my horror the money was extracted from my account within 3 days (there was a weekend in between). Money as far as I'm concerned taken from my account under false pretences as I had not signed the relevant paperwork. I am of course looking at legal advice unless the 'manager' whoever he is.....an Ed Brown I believe.......comes up with another solution once he receives my letter. My last attempt at contacting this 'elusive' figure will be by letter. Never available on the phone....no email address, whoever heard of a business without an email address and never at the hotel in person. Odd! Does this person exist? As far as I'm concerned the hotel should be condemned. It is totally misrepresented in its advertising and should undergo immediate inspection. The sad thing is that it is in a superb location and has the potential to be a first rate small and friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Shawn-YYZ
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and stay in hotels all over the world. This is one of the most unique hotels I've stayed at - I can see why some people would love it and some people would hate it. It really depends what you're looking for and what is important to you. Positives: - Very attentive and friendly staff. Better than most 5-star hotels in this regard. - Room was spotlessly clean and well maintained. Tasteful wallpaper and decor. New bathroom fixtures. - Very comfortable mattress with high-quality bedding and pillows. - Modern in-room safe big enough for a laptop. - Big wall-mounted flatscreen TV. - Free high-speed Internet. - Free Internet cafe in the lobby with two computers for anyone who didn't bring their own. - Lounge area near the lobby, lots of power outlets and good wireless Internet coverage. - Excellent location - near Times Square and a block's walk from 3 different subway lines. Negatives: - Tiny room with barely enough room to walk around the bed. You may not get a view out the window either. - Wireless Internet had poor reception in my room. - One small elevator. - Some public areas of the hotel need work (carpet tattered, some walls need painting, etc.). - No room service or onsite restaurant (but you're in Times Square and many restaurants will deliver there, and you're right around the corner from many good places to eat). All in all I found this hotel a very good value for the money I spent and in my opinion the positives here far outweigh the negatives. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: stygging
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean. There was some problem with the internet wifi when I was there, so I hardly used it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: lawly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good budget option. It is kept clean and is in a great location on 49th Street. It is far from luxurious, the rooms are really tiny, but the shower was good and the bed was comfy. If you are looking for a hotel just for sleeping in, the Mayfair is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, Hotel is worth it”
Reviews.Author: 4InMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for Marathon weekend 2010, the cost was nearly $200 cheaper than the race hotels we were looking at in midtown. We knew what we were getting into, an older, smaller hotel without the amenities of the chains. We essentially got exactly what we were looking for, great location, great rate (considering it was an event weekend in NYC). The hotel is older and the halwaysbeing narrow and elevator being small and slow are accurate, who cares?? We had a king room with the pull out chair and those rooms are at the front of the hotel, that means street noise can be expected. Room was clean, bathroom was clean and was of good size. Location was great, a couple minute walk to anywhere. My negatives were that the tv remote also controlled the AC/Heat unit so if you changed the channel you were changing the settings on the unit as well. Funny, and easly cured by changing the channel at the tv itself. The issue with that was when it turned the heat on and the heat smell that is associated with heaters sets off the smoke alarm. Then at 3am the first night the heat kicked on automatically which triggered the smoke alarm again, that wasn't funny, would have been worse if it happen on race morning. I solved that problem by unplugging the Heater/AC, the room temp was fine and we didn't need either, I'd think in the middle of winter it could be an issue. The other complaint would be that prior guests must have tried to solve the smaoke detector problem by disconnecting it, but unlike many household detectors these are direct wired and our detector seemed to be hanging by the wires (Within a wire mesh cage to prevent removal) We asked the hotel to look at the smoke detector when we were out for the day, they never did. It worked so we were safe but it probably should have been repaired by maintenance. All in all it was a serviceable hotel in midtown for cheaper than the chains. We will be in NYC again and we will definitely stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBack1
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location, right of Broadway in Midtown Manhattan just steps from a subway station. The hotel is old and cramped but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Sailor-NHYC
Reviews.Content: Great location on 49th St in the heart of the Theater District. Our room was very small and looked out into a ventilation shaft. The Hotel has had its better days. Tiny elevator hardly accommodates 3 people.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip to the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: mugsysmom04
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 3 hours before our room was available so they stored our luggage allowing us to go to Times Square and check out the restaurants before checking in. The staff was very friendly and with only 78 rooms they recognized us each time we came back from our travels around the city. The desk clerk was very knowledgable of the area and the sights to be sure not to miss. Our room was on the back side of the hotel and, although we didn't have a view, it was VERY quiet. We didn't even hear the church bells from across the street which rang every hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolMenloPark
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the location is incredible. The room was super small, but clean and the people who work there are really friendly, helpful and nice. Glad it wasn't hot, because the air conditioner didn't work very well, but we would probably stay there again because of the incredible location. The bed was comfortable and as I said before, the room was clean and the bathroom was well supplied. Location, location, location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value! Great location, good price (for NY patterns), great double bed room. LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: marciarrc
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel. Itâ€™s really close to Times Square and theaters. Nice staff, breakfast included (simple, but fair enough). Paid $ 230 a night, worth it all!

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and great price”
Reviews.Author: sciencetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayfair over the weekend, while attending a weekend seminar. As everyone has said, the room was very small, a double bed, a small desk with a TV over the desk. There was a wall niche with a telephone in it, on the wall by the bed. The bathroom was clean and in decent shape. There could a been a few more amenities replaced. Just the basic shampoo, lotion, soap, shower cap (the first night only) maybe there was a shoe shine cloth. Overall I liked the French Toile wallpaper and matching bed linens. It was cute and had charm. It was a bit worn in a few spots, but not enough to look bad. The sheets were very clean. The hotel was basically very nice, with an English feel to it. It had two internet stations past the lobby area, which were free for hotel guests. You needed to get buzzed in by the lobby clerk. There also was a place up in the room, by the desk, in which you could hook up your computer. There really was no view, but curtains covered the windows and it wasn't an issue. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an inexpensive option for a place to stay. It was central to most places. None of the rooms have two double beds, I was told this by the front desk. So if you need two beds, then this hotel won't work for you. The mattress was comfortable, the water in the shower was hot. I can't think of anything that I didn't like. It was a great deal for the price, in Manhattan. It is a nice boutique hotel.with a European feel to it. The rooms had wall safes, cable TV and internet access. It is close to Broadway, Times Square, Rockerfella Plaza and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “The best location but expensive considering the actual room.”
Reviews.Author: invaders82
Reviews.Content: The best location but expensive considering the actual room. We decided to pay this sort of price beacuse of the location of the hotel itself, right opposite where the Chicago show was being played, and becasue we would only use it to literally sleep, but the room quality, size and amenities did not worth the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “The Good: location The Bad & Ugly ; .. sigh ...”
Reviews.Author: RoaminRomano
Reviews.Content: Great Location up from Times Square.The rooms are like tight boxes.The rates not bad considering what you get.The staff, maids and restaurant nice.. BUT THATS IT!The day time front desk staff except for the african lady are untrustworthy I checked "peaches" the manager out ..this is what I found googling beatricemacevedo.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Very cute”
Reviews.Author: Circuit231
Reviews.Content: Its small but its New York what did you expect? Wallpaper and pillowcases are kind of tacky but add to the charm. Since it was a 3 day stay we hardly stayed in the room so for what it was totally worth it. near all the Broadway shows, and Times Square. Dont expect the Plaza but expect something nice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gets an "A" in my book!!”
Reviews.Author: Blink4u
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. Clean room, priced right. Small but enough room that you don't feel cramped. Tub and shower. Soft big towels. Bedding plush and very comfortable. Will stay there again on our next trip to the Big Apple!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for New York”
Reviews.Author: mplsmarion
Reviews.Content: I travel alone to New York fairly often and always stay in budget hotels, so I've learned to lower my expectations. There is nowhere else where I would consider $200 a night to be a budget hotel, but in NY it is. Keeping that in mind, the Mayfair was a decent hotel for that price. The room was small, but bigger than many other NY hotels. The air conditioning worked perfectly - important since it was 90 degrees outside. My room was in the back and considering there is a theater right next door, I heard nothing. Slept like a baby. The bathroom was relatively clean and the water was HOT. The room had a TV and a computer station. I didn't use it, I used the one in the "business center" in the lobby. I'm still waiting to see if I got charged for it. The room was clean and the linens and towels were spotless, soft and fresh-smelling. That's a big one for me. I can't stand musty or dirty-looking linens and towels. The housekeeper even came in as I was moving in to change one of the pillow shams because it didn't match. The room decor is getting a little shabby and was downright odd. Everything from the wallpaper to the curtains, the bedspread, the pillow shams and even the lampshades were all covered in the same exact French-style blue and cream print. At first glance, it was hard to see the wall lamps and even find the bed! It was like playing Where's Waldo. Downsides: the lobby, the hallways and the elevator were filthy and completely worn. This was not a good first impression, although it made the room a pleasant surprise. It would be worth their time and money to fix those areas up. As others have the said, the location is amazing. 2 blocks from two different subway stops giving you access to most subway lines. One block from Broadway - right in the theater district. Half-a-block from 9th Avenue where all the restaurants are. A billion people on the streets all night long so it's very safe walking. The best thing in my opinion was the staff. Friendly hotel staff are rare in New York and everyone - day crew, night crew, front desk, or cleaners - were so nice at the Mayfair. It doesn't take much effort to say "hello" or "have a nice time" or make small talk and more hotels should work on this. Shabby facilities are easily forgiven when the staff make you feel welcome. And it rubs off on the guests. People in the lobby were chatting with each other also. Thumbs up to the staff at the Mayfair!

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brindle1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the mayfair new years day and the sunday after and have absolutely no reservations on staying there again. as some others have mentioned the rooms, elevator are small, the hallways narrow but none are too small to do their job. the staff was always pleasant and answered all questions we had. you do have to walk up steps to get to the lobby and normally there will be no doorman for you. anyone who stays at the mayfair should be relatively mobile. i do not recommend the hotel if you are mobility impaired or bringing a large amount of luggage. two small to medium bags is all that will fit in the room and even at that you'll be moving them out of the way most everytime you move within the room. in short we want to go back to the times square area again but this time in the summer season and if we do we'll be staying at mayfair again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: FoxValleyGal
Reviews.Content: Just right for a two-night business trip. Good location. The hot water is really hot! The bed is comfortable, the room was quiet, I got a great night's sleep. Clean, nice towels, bright bathroom. Staff was friendly and it was nice to see other guests actually sitting and chatting in the lobby. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but small and old room..”
Reviews.Author: dizzitelli
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I spent 2 nights in this hotels with my girlfriend, we was at the room 211, at the second floor of this hotel. The room was not really well provided expecially because it was having a small wardrobe and few space available, but it were well furnished (maybe a little bit old, but as New York..). But I was expecting more for 200$ at nights. We had a good permanence in this hotel except for the noise that came every time from outside and stops around 10.30 p.m. All the zone it's really noisy but I think that a similar hotel had to have better system of noise isolations Anyway I recommend it to all expecially for small permanence because it's located very well, but for many days for a very quite zone of the city, well organized and really next to the subway I suggest Hotel Newton for my experience. Regards Domenico

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: wallus
Reviews.Content: You'd do better with a moderately-priced chain hotel. Lured in by the ratings, I was so disappointed. Dirty frayed carpet, dirty toile wallpaper coming off the wall in the rooms, exposed wires coming out of the walls, towel stuffed over a window jam to keep weather out, single tiny dingy elevator, etc. It's the worst. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean room, nice staff, will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: LightHippie
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I stayed here. I knew it would be clean, because TripAdvisor members had said it was, but I didn't expect my room to be as large, or as pretty as it was. My room had a Double bed and a pull out bed for one (from a large chair in the corner). It had a computer and desk with some storage above it, a two drawer dresser, a small closet, and a nice size bathroom with a shower/tub combo. There was an Ironing board and iron in my closet, but I didn't use them. There was bedding for the pull out bed in the closet, too, but I didn't use that either. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I had left a hat in my room after I checked out, and the maid brought it out to me while I waited for the elevator. My room did face the street, and there was a little street noice, but nothing that kept me up, or woke me up. The subway is just one short block away. There are two theatres on the same block, and many more within walking distance. The lobby is comfortable, and has a very clean bathroom on the same floor. I really enjoyed The Mayfair Hotel, and look forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Two Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pacers49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from staying at the Mayfair for 2 nights. We would definitely stay there again. As some reviewers have mentioned, the rooms aren't huge, but were comfortable enough for us. We had a king room on the street side, and as one might imagine, it could get pretty noisy, but we had planned ahead and brought a fan! My husband has to have that 'white noise' anyway but it drowned out any street noise and we got a decent night's sleep. The hotel was very clean; the bathroom looked brand new. There did seem to be an odor on the second floor but I am sure it was probably an isolated incident. Water pressure was great, but again, that hot water does come out pretty hot if you aren't careful. The location was fabulous and within walking distance to many of the main attractions. And, the value was great, as we did not find a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Lisam71
Reviews.Content: Rooms needed updating, shabby carpeting. Heater didn't work well.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff, horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Fairview_Objective
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayfair 3 nights in November 2007. Although my company paid full price, the room I was given was a "bit" and I mean just a bit larger than the bed itself! The staff was not helpful with any questions I had regarding local places to eat or other attractions. They were just not friendly, I mean they didn't even greet anyone! The wall mounted air conditioning and heating unit was so loud that every time it would come on it would wake me up! The two small windows in the room looked onto a dirty brick wall 2 feet away. The area was infested with loud and filthy pigeons. Unfriendly staff combined with a terrible facility equates to a bad choice. I would not recommend staying there to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Gia8643
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mayfair about 8 or 9 times over the past five years. I travel to NYC from Houston often. I usually go alone and find that I feel very safe at the Mayfair. The front desk has always made me feel comfortable coming in late and any time I need something. The location could not be better. There are restaurants to the left that are great. There is a computer cafe a few doors down. Fantastic little boutique hotel. I can't imagine anyone having a negative opinion of this place. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Travelin
Reviews.Content: What an amazing little find! Well within walking distance of all the theaters and Times Square. Our room was a double, and that was about it, a double bed but assuredly the MOST comfortable bed we have slept in for a l o n g time. The room was VERY clean and seemed newly renovated. Not a ton of room, but we didn't need that.( I only gave it 3 stars because of the size. Everything else about the room demanded 5 stars.) We had the red wallpaper, headboard, a TV that got enough channels, a remote controlled heater/AC, a small closet and places to put your stuff and a very clean functional bathroom. We did open our 3rd floor window (opened to an alley) and was cooed to sleep by the pigeons. The water was scalding hot (watch out) and it took both of us to figure out how to get the water up to the shower (push the little knob in HARD). Great water pressure, little soaps and towels were just fine. There is a powerful hairdryer and iron. This hotel obviously has been around for a while, but there is nothing that shouts "old" or "musty". There is mahogany paneling in the lobby that is pretty classy looking. There are framed vintage black and white photos every where depicting old time famous stars. There is a internet area in the lobby as well as a baby grand piano ready to be played. AND someone was when we returned from our evening. We grabbed our bottle of wine and thoroughly enjoyed the "concert in the lobby". OH, we needed some ice and the conceirge brought it right up in a very nice ice bucket with lid. They also stored our luggage after check out. Very nice staff. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are ok without the glitz and coldness of chain hotels. This is a NYC jem.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but plenty comfy, great for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: MamaMoose8
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about going to this hotel, but I trusted the reviews and pics on this site and was not disappointed. I went with realistic expectations and was pleasantly surprised. Yes the room was small, but it was very clean and charming. The bathroom was very nice, though the hot water was HOT, so turn the cold water on first. The internet was not functional on my computer, but I did not spend much time in the room to work on the computer. The bed was very comfortable. Room was great for naps and sleeping, I am not sure I would want to spend extended lengths of time there. I was there for work near Times Square so I was not in the room a lot. There was only one huge negative. I asked for a room on the street side because one of the reviewers said those rooms were larger. The room was larger, but the street was NOISY. I know many of my friends wondered what I expected from New York City. I succumbed to ear plugs and even with that, one morning I awakened to a jack hammer outside. Even with that, I would stay there again. It was clean. I felt safe. It was near everything I was there to see. The bed was comfy. I don't need too many extras.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Bruce...Screw everyone else”
Reviews.Author: alexiswar
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed bruce...he was nice charming and well dressed and kept...everything else was wrong..the asian worker was very mean lloking and the cacusian male behind the desk was swearing and drinking..Bruce sent me to Da Marino witch helped my hinger.Then the A.C broke their was bruce to help me again he always was there to help.. he should run the hotel...i went there last week and he was gone why he should run that rat hole... other than bruce i hated my trip

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff; small room but very clean and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: AL_Retired
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, accommodating and helpful. The location was within walking distance of all the Broadway theaters, Times Square, and great restaurants. Bathroom very modern and always spotless. Room small but acceptable. BUT... the elevator broke two different nights! (84 steps to roomâ€”every time.) Door lock malfunctioned twice (each time we had to wait while the front desk sent someone up to reset it). Upon arrival, the hotel's WiFi router blocked all outgoing email. (To their credit, they gave me their ISP's number. So *I* waited on hold for 30 minutes, explained the problem to the ISP's tech support person, who then called management to obtain confirmation that it was okay with them that their customers' email not be blocked. The manager agreed. Problem solvedâ€”but by me, not the hotel.) Reading lights over bed connected to a switch behind headboard fastened to wall. (Bellman's fix? "Just don't use them.") One drawer stuck shut. (Bellman told us how to "jiggle it just right and it'll open.") Thermostat on wall not connected to anything; bellman had to come up (again) to show us how to use a remote control instead. (Sounds convenientâ€”except the air conditioner's remote receiver is mounted on the top of the unit so, to use the remote, you must stand in front of it, raise the remote over your head, and aim it at the ceiling. And the remote is sealed inside a wooden box. At least it wasn't nailed down.) TV remote control had a dead button. (Front desk provided a different remote.) No instructions how to connect to WiFi; had to call and ask. (What's so difficult about printing an info card?) Dark window shade jammed in closed position making it impossible to ever get any daylight into the room. (Bellman's fix? "That's just the way it is." There was no view, but daylight would be nice.) Toilet seat loose.

Reviews.Title: “Travel writer says it's a gem”
Reviews.Author: traveljournaler
Reviews.Content: As a travel writer, I found this to be a great location & price. I walked back from the theater easily instead of having to find a cab. The room was decorated tastefully and cleverly designed for the size, which I found cozy. The staff was kind and recommended Da Marino Italian Restaurant a few doors down. Even for a single diner, it was romantic and wonderfully New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couple nights stay!”
Reviews.Author: chrsmthws
Reviews.Content: Before I booked my reservation, I read another review who gave the skinny. It really helped me, so I thought I'd try and do the same: No, there aren't a lot of frills, although free wi-fi was a big one for me. The room was tiny tiny, but perfect for a solo traveler who's going to be spending more time out seeing the city than sitting in his hotel room lounging. At such an affordable rate in such a good location and kind of expecting a horror story, I was excitedly surprised to find the complete opposite. The room was clean and had all I needed and more than I expected: a full private bathroom with towels (as opposed to the shared bathrooms you find at other cheap places in the city), a closet to hang my clothes, an iron & board, and a comfy bed. The customer service I dealt with was polite and efficient. I felt safe. Like I said, it is budget--but isn't that why you're picking it? The location in TImes Square is perfect. And the rate couldn't be beat. I would definitely recommend and go back. Don't expect The Hilton cause you're not paying for The Hilton--you're saving your money to spend out in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HoleinOneBarrie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4-days. Nothing fancy however the rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The street noise in the early morning can be bothersome if you choose to sleep to at least 8. No restaurant, no ice machines (you must ask for it) no in-room coffee makers. Rooms are small as is the elevator. Found a great breakfast place on Broadway called Stardust, the waiters sing while diners dine, a very enjoyable experience. Take the 2 or 3 day double decker bus tour it is well worth it. The room decor is dated but more European in nature. We didn't visit the Big Apple to stay in our room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: southdublin
Reviews.Content: everyone has different expectations when it comes to hotels. when you stay in new york, what i look for is a good clean room in a good location and then service. Yes the rooms here are small. I stayed here 3 nights and really enjoyed it. I didnt see cock roaches running around the place. I didnt find the rooms dirty. In fact my room ,509 was spotless and the sheets etc were all changed each day. The bathroom was old school but again clean. the room and hotel is old school. its in the theatre fashion. Wall paper, wooden panels. i found this a novelty given most other chain hotels are boring and identical all aorund the world. I perfer personality. In new york this place is a treat. Next of all its right at time square. location is amazing. word of advice though is that there isnt really a big sign on street so you may walk past it. Its right opp the actors church. if you look to have a breakfast in a new york hotel you are wasting your time. there are countless deli and diners all over the place and are very cheap. explore the place and eat out!take a left out of the hotel onto 8th ave and make a right. 3 blocks down theres the cosmic diner which is open 24 hrs. good food here.also i found the staff at the mayfair very helpful. they gave me a late check out and didnt rip me off 300 dollars (see other review) that the best western did. the mayfair is homely.if you want to spend the day lying in hotel room its small but for a few days in nyc its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, run down with cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveller100
Reviews.Content: I unfortunatly had to stay at this hotel for one night as everything else was booked up or very expensive. I'm not a hotel snob and have stayed in perfectly nice 2* hotels in the past. I paid Â£180 on lastminute.com for the night which was ridiculous - it wasn't worth Â£30! I very nearly packed my stuff up and left to find another hotel no matter how much it cost. The room was tiny, not exactly spotless and I found hair on my pillow. I had a terrible nights sleep as it was so unhomely. I packed up quickly in the morning (oh and my wake up call was 30 mins late) and as I was leaving there was another guest saying he wasn't paying for his room as he had found a cockroach and dumped it out on the counter. Suffice to say I woudn't recommend staying here under any circumstances - spend a bit more if you have to and stay at a well known hotel or major chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelko888
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here in June for business. The location is fantastic, just off Broadway and a quick walk to Time's Square, Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue. The room was cozy and there was free internet access via a PC they had in the room. Staff was friendly and didn't hesitate to help me get a car for the airport. If I ever have to go back to NYC, this is where I'd stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location friendly bell captain”
Reviews.Author: Akahn610
Reviews.Content: No room to swing a cat but clean, quiet & you can open the window to a brick wall opposite very private :)) Comfy bed - what more do you need? A little ensuite. The bonus was a PC in the room with internet at no charge! Plus its near to EVERYTHING! Times Square. the Big M Shop the Red on off bus all within easy walking!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it SO much, we came back for our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: loves2ski
Reviews.Content: I won't go into a lot of detail, because I have already written a previous review for a previous stay here, but I will say this, THE MAYFAIR is the BEST!! When we called the hotel, they remembered me from several previous visits. They were giving us a discount (which is VERY hard to find in December in NYC), but when we told them that it was for our honeymoon, they went out of their way to make it a TRULY special stay for us! Champagne awaiting us in our hotel room! Great staff! Everyone was so helpful in helping us to find perfect romantic spots to visit and eat! Carriage rides through central park, the Top of the Rock at midnight, ice skating a Wollman Rink....it was a perfect NYC Honeymoon! The Mayfair doesn't disappoint! You just have to know who to talk to and when, where to ask for your room to be, and let them get to know you. The service is unbelievable when you do so. (psssst....the rooms on the street happen to be a lot bigger!) Our first stay here was in a room where you opened the door and fell onto a bed and had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom! We LOVED and LAUGHED over that! Not many times you can say that you have that experience. Only when we saw one of the maids going into one of the rooms facing the front of the hotel did we realize that THAT was what we needed to be asking for! We will ALWAYS stay at the Mayfair! No CC fraud here, and no problems at all with the staff! Just a LOVELY, unique hotel in a perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Theatrewench
Reviews.Content: My mother found this hotel online a couple of years ago so we decided to try it out. The rooms are very small as several other people have said in their reviews, but they really are very charming. The staff was helpful and friendly, answering all of our questions about the best places to eat or shop, one of the men even gave us a subway map and highlighted the route to where we were going. And, for theatre people such as my mother and I, it was in the perfect place. We loved it, in fact, we're staying there again in a week! If you want a comfortable and affordable hotel close to everything, the Mayfair is definitely the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: tincoral
Reviews.Content: And if you are in New York City, that is really all that you should be doing in your room any way!!! I was so pleased to have found this place so close to all of the shows that I wanted to see for my short stay in NYC. The rooms were tiny, yes. But every single room that I have booked in NYC has been small. It was clean, quiet, and the bed was comfortable. The hotel staff was friendly, and helpful. Normally I would not want to be right in Times Square, but I was there to see plays and I was in town for just over 48 hours so I wanted to spend less time traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Let's Be Fair, Shall We?”
Reviews.Author: lyketotravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to get slammed by folks who don't understand NYC or choose not to. Yes, the rooms are small. Most rooms only have showers. There's only one small, slow elevator. The TV is tiny. And the restaraunt doesn't exist. But you know what, I don't go to NYC to be a troll in my hotel room. I want to be out and about. I only need a room to a) store my stuff, b) catch a few hours of sleep, and c) clean up. This place offers all that within one block of Times Square for less than $150/night. The room I had was clean, the bed was very comfortable, there was plenty of hot water(even had this fancy faucet that told you the water temp), no evidence of rodents anywhere, it was quiet, the WiFi was free, and the staff was pleasant. So you'll get no whining from me. If you're going to NYC to be a troll and live in a cave, then don't book this place. You will hate it. But if all you want is a place to crash for a few hours, then by all means check out the Mayfair. If you're looking for some sort of "hidden" bargain, keep looking. If you want a nice luxurious room in that locale, go pay the $200/night, just don't book at the Mayfair then whine about it afterwards. Once again, let me be clear...this is a clean, comfortable, no frills place at a good price in a great location (like the real estate knuckleheads will location, location, location). If you want the Waldorf Astoria, then go there and pay that price.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, nasty hotel......”
Reviews.Author: rantur1
Reviews.Content: This was probably the most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in. It was literally one step above a transient hotel. Rooms were small, but that didn't bother me. It was that the place was so dark and dirty. Was to stay there for 4 nights, but checked out after one night and went to the Paramount. Sure it was about $150 more a night, but the money was well spent just to get out of this rathole. I agree w/ others that the pictures on the websites (hotels.com) were TOTALLY misrepresented. It's a dark / dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, small rooms, check your credit card balance.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesMax
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a week to find an apartment in the city. Rate was good, room was predictably small but comfortable, restaurant was under renovation, elevator was under repair but was operational by the time I left. When I returned to LA, I found that my credit card had been charged twice for the room; hotel staff said that they were having computer problems and accidently billed some people twice. That was 4 days ago and I haven't seen the charge removed as promised; today I will have to file a dispute with my credit card company. One more headache in the middle of a cross-country relocation. I would recommend the hotel, though... certainly worth the price, as long as you only pay once for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: soLA09
Reviews.Content: The rooms are painfully small. If you are looking for some place modern this is not for you. It was pretty clean. If your not planning on spending the whole day in your room it is ok. we just needed a place to get a couple hours of sleep. the price is ok for new york i guess. But i thought it was a little high for what you got. The bed was comfy though. (or maybe I was just tired) good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Times Square Location at an Economical Price.”
Reviews.Author: worldlycanuck
Reviews.Content: After deciding that very morning to go to NYC for a long weekend that evening, found this hotel on an internet search site. Had never heard of it before, but their website and reviews seemed reputable. Reservation made with front desk staff on 1-800 line. Ended up being billed for a lower rate than what I had been quoted on the phone. Hotel is very convenient to the 49th/50th St stop on the A/C/E subway lines, as well as the 1 and N lines, all of which are half a block away. Hotel is kept clean and shiney for such an old building. There are two staff at the front desk 24/7. All staff were always professional for a small-scale hotel like this. Hotel is 7 storeys with a classic early 20th-century closet-sized elevator. Speaking of closet-sized, the rooms are classic-New York - very small by modern standards. The hotel had obviously been converted from an SRO (single-room occupancy) building over the years, but was very clean. Ask for a room at the front of the hotel (the '04's for example) as they offer a view of 49th street. The rooms are air-conditioned but the windows also opened fully, which was a nice feature you rarely see anymore). Washrooms and showers have lots of hot water and were very clean and well-maintained. Housekeeping was friendly and quick to make up room. An excellent touch is a full computer in every room, including printer. High-speed internet is free. Great if you don't want to lug your laptop on the trip with you. I totally wasn't expecting that, and it was a great selling feature to get me to come back. Good for looking up restaurants, etc. It is an economy hotel, and as such, I did not see pop or ice machines in the hotel. There is a modern market and bodegas at the end of the block at the corner of 8th Av. There is a restaurant/bar space beside the lobby currently under renovation. Check-out is noon and there were no surprises on the bill. Got the impression that the hotel was a professionally run operation that could be trusted. There was a safe in my room for valuables. Would stay here again as it is an incredibly convenient location to Times Sqaure and the Theatre District. Be prepared for an old, clean building with lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: pizzaqueen205
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on our annual girls trip for the last two years, and just made reservations for our stay this June. The staff is excellent, the rooms clean, and the location is in walking distance of everything we need. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hosts -- we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Michigandress
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for five days over the Thanksgiving holiday, when we met up with our kids and extended family. We couldn't have found better, more affordable lodgings for our needs. No, the rooms are not large; think old-school dorm room. So what? You're in NEW YORK CITY -- get out and see the city, people! For us the hotel was a clean, comfortable, friendly home base for a very busy week of sightseeing and family get-togethers; we had breakfast across the street at the Food Emporium, caught the subway around the corner and spent what little free time we had poking around the immediate neighborhood. The Mayfair staff was incredible -- so friendly, helpful and accomodating. And we enjoyed the quirky, vintage feel of the Mayfair as well; we wondered how many well-known performers had stayed there as hopeful young arrivals just off the bus or playing the theater circut at the beginning of their careers. I suppose if you're the sort of traveler who expects the cookie-cutter sameness of a freeway-exit chain motel whererever you go you'll be disappointed by a place like the Mayfair; but we found it charming and wonderful, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable value hotel in the heart of the Theater District.

Reviews.Title: “if you have to stay here change your plans”
Reviews.Author: hickorynut2
Reviews.Content: the worst hotel we have ever stayed in...completely misrepresented online..the hotel and rooms looked completely different. The hotel was under renovation which was not mentioned at booking. There were no amenities...the rooms were so small it was hard for 2 people to walk around at the same time. The whole appearance was shabby. The internet service did not work, The room rate was higher than what they were charging coming in off the street. Definitely affected our New York experience which would have been great except for this terrible hotel. If it is the only hotel available, change your plans!

Reviews.Title: “Stop Complaining, You get exactly what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: bobbyv8
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is small, 78 rooms total. The entrance and lobby are both decorated with wood paneling. A very beautiful and unique look. The rooms are small; but this is New York and in a building dating back to the early 1900's. If you travel to NY to stay in a hotel room your incredibly stupid. I stayed at the Milford Plaza near by and encountered similar sized rooms. The rooms are clean and the beds are very comfortable. Maintenance is needed in the building, small things such as minor cracks in some mirrors and maybe an occasional leaking faucet. Although; maintenance seems to be on duty almost always and assisted me with these minor details. The staff was willing to go out of their way to help me. The concierge literally walked me down the block to my destination. In addition he fixed the wifi connection on my laptop; which is definitely out of his way. If you want to save some money at the expense of a small room, and lack of luxury, this is the place. The place has everything a human needs to survive pleasurably and more. If your picky and dwell on insignificant details such as lavash furnishings, gold plated chandeliers and room service go elsewhere. If you want a place to stay at a clean hotel with Victorian decorated rooms with a warm and friendly desk staff and concierge, near by parking, wifi internet with Ethernet connections in the rooms and very very comfortable beds; stay at the Mayfair. Well worth the inexpensive price to stay in the heart of one of the most expensive cities in the world. Oh and there are no bugs, myself and a business associate stay here a couple times a month. Also we never had a problem with the billing. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great day”
Reviews.Author: johnmarynyc
Reviews.Content: my wife and i would stay here again & again the location is just great and the price can not be beat also the staff are the best. The rooms were very clean but very small but has i see it were only sleeping there also the parking was cheep for New York there might be better places to stay but were do you want to spend your money ? on a room were you sleep or in the city that dosen't sleep. John Naugatuck ct.

Reviews.Title: “The Mayfair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: two1749
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair Hotel from December 23-30, 2008. We enjoyed our stay and would do it again. It's small, but it's location next to Times Square made up for it. We are from Texas and had never been to New York City before. The staff were friendly and helpful. Here's a short video I made of our room: http://youtube.com/watch?v=gcLPwO-P4l4

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: WendyNYRochester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the very low cost in comparison to other hotels in the very desireable area of times square. It was not worth it. We walked the streets just to avoid going back to our room. The rooms were smaller than the ones we recently encountered in Europe. Our room was literally the size of a walk in closet, just a little over the width of a King size bed. The shower had mold in between the tiles. The bathroom door was in disrepair and a ceiling light fixture was torn off. The front desk staff were very unfriendly. There is no longer a restaurant connected with the hotel and there are still renovations on-going. We could not find anything similar at the hotel that was in the internet pictures or in the brochure. Try the Hotel Edison. A very reasonable and quality hotel just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Disabled traveler told to leave electric mobility scooter in LOBBY”
Reviews.Author: eLuxuryofCR
Reviews.Content: One of the office staff at my company's HQ booked the room because it was inexpensive with a good location. I called in advance in make sure that there was a WORKING elevator and that access with my electric mobility scooter would not be a problem; I was given assurances that there was a ramp and all would be OK. I arrived to find that there were steps at the front entrance. I asked where the ramp entrance was located and was informed that the ramp was ONLY for luggage. The doorman said that he would lift my scooter into the lobby when I needed to come and go. Once inside I learned that I would not be allowed to use my scooter to get to my room because the mgr felt that the elevator was too small to accommodate it (I didn't agree and I'm the one with 10+ yrs experience using the scooter0. Then the mgr said that I might damage the elevator with the scooter and they couldn't risk it. I asked if the hotel referred travelers that they couldn't accommodate to another property but was told (and I believed it) that with the NY Gift show that week, I wouldn't find a room elsewhere. So, I left my scooter in the lobby, reluctantly left my only key to it with the front desk, and went to my room. Yes, they put me in a room near the elevator and, yes, as other reviewers have stated, the room was closet-sized. The bathroom was almost as large as the room. The room was decorated in toile fabrics, but showed some wear. The next day when I went downstairs, the mgr told me that they were completely booked and that someone would only be available to help me with my scooter once (out) in the morning and once (in) in the evening. In other words, I'd better do whatever I needed to do before coming back to the hotel, because once I was in, that was it for the day. I was furious and threatened to call whatever NYC agency that handled ADA complaints; I was told to go ahead. I actually did call and was given the run around from a city office regarding landmark properties. So I spent 8 days at the Mayfair under these conditions. Their restaurant was closed for renovations and I ended up buying my dinner from the hot/cold buffet bar at the Food Emporium supermarket nearby and carrying it back to the hotel along with whatever I needed to drink for the evening, plus my briefcase, purse, etc. My company had prepaid the cost of the room so I had no recourse with the hotel, there was nothing I could do but put up with an incredibly insensitive mgr and an old hotel that didn't meet ADA requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: rainbow2bike
Reviews.Content: I was quoted a price of 190 but then charged 340. The staff was inpossible to work with, and everything had to go through a mangager who was never around. Most importantly, one of their employees stole my credit card number and charged $2000 to it, and the hotel staff didn't care or even attempt to amend things. This was by far my worst hotel experiece ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: coljon
Reviews.Content: While the hotels website is using photos of the public rooms and frontage that were probably taken some years ago and which can be initially disappointing on arrival when one sees it as now - somewhat tired; and after being shown to a room that was on the small side (I suppose it is New York), things began to pick up. During our visit the hotel was undergoing a renovation to the interior public room that promises well for future visitors. While small, the bedroom was very clean and welcoming; while the bathroom had been recently updated and was fine and well stocked with shampoos, soaps etc. Equally, all the staff were very helpful and probably aware that the initial website promise was not quite being met and wanted to make your stay as comfortable as possible. However what really worked was its location. Less than a 300 feet walk to the uptown or downtown Gray bus stops, right in the middle of the Theatre District , restaurants almost on the doorstep, and less than 4 minutes from Times Square. Pricing $300 per night felt a bit high, but again it is NY. Would recommend it with the above caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal by NYC Standards”
Reviews.Author: SFSolo
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair has certainly passed its prime, but is still an excellent value in what has become a ridiculously expensive market. You won't find mention on the website, but renovations have closed the connected restaurant next door (the "Garrick") and it does not look like it's going to be reopening anytime soon. The lobby is half torn up, as well, and the gent at the desk sighed and said it had been going on as long as he has worked there, with no end in sight. This is actually a reason for hope, however, as the biggest problem with the Mayfair is that it is simply tired and needs a facelift. Maybe it's on the way. Reviews have pointed out that the rooms are tiny, and indeed they are. This is perhaps what the hotel means when it refers to its "European" style (I didn't see much of Europe there otherwise), and in fact I have not seen rooms this small outside of Europe. I was in what was referred to as a "petite single" room (# 307), and in a hotel already famed for small rooms, I was a little worried about that. But it was fine -- a bed which was a little wider than a standard twin and just about enough room to put your feet down on either side. Have to note that there are numerous maintenance issues (missing light shades, a bathroom faucet that would not turn off, most of the TV stations were out, etc.) There was, technically, a window but it opens out onto a brick wall about three feet away and since I was on the third floor, I could not tell whether it was daytime or nighttime by looking, so I just left the curtain closed. The carpet and elevator should have been retired long ago. Those are the negatives though. On the positive side, first and foremost, this is a comfortable, quiet and secure-feeling hotel, with a fine bed, clean sheets and towels, in an absolutely fabulous location. Next door to the Eugene O'Neill theater, across from "Chicago" (although I don't recommend seeing it). The lovely St. Malachy's Church (the "Actor's Chapel") is directly across the street, offering Mass, Adoration and just a peaceful, quiet island in the most bustling place in North America. Times Square is just around the corner and Carnegie Hall is about six walkeable blocks away. Also, easy access to various subway lines. So, if you do not plan to do much more than sleep in the hotel (like me), the rest is not a problem. And the price was, by NY standards, a real steal. Some prior reviews complained about the staff, but my experience with them was nothing but good from start to finish. Consistently helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: touristpr
Reviews.Content: Were there from oct. 9 to oct .12 , '08, great place to stay, clean beds, clean bathroom, relatively quiet. Small elevator and small room , but enough for what you want if you are a tourist in NYC. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: JDNEBR
Reviews.Content: Terrible property with poor maintenance. Had no other options due to fashion week. Rooms smelled, stained linens. Would not recomend for anyone. We were in town for business and stayed away from facility as long as possilbe. TD

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny67
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. It is in an incredible location- right in the heart of the theatre district. The room itself was small, but comfortable and we had room for our two large suitcases to remain on the floor. The room was tidy, the bathroom clean and our bed comfortable. There was a hairdryer, iron and ample cupboard space. The staff were friendly and we felt very safe. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive - In need of a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: tigerwingpiston
Reviews.Content: As we approached the hotel my daughter commented on how dirty the windows and facade were. She is 9 years old. I was concerned when I went to open the front door and there was only 1 door handle (double doors). The front desk staff was dressed in jeans and t-shirts. OKAY. They told me that the elevator was not working when I was given my door key for a room on the 5th floor. I thought, "what have a gotten myself (and young daughter) into? I paid $818 for 3 nights. The staff was VERY NICE & HELPFUL. But it is a shame that the owner does not take pride in the hotel. There were a lot of European guests staying there and the hotel was sold out for the weekend that we stayed there. But again - one should take pride in where you work and in one's investment.
