The carpet throughout the hotel (lobby, stairs & room) was very soiled. The walls were dirty and the wall paper was peeling in many sections. On our last night the elevator was fixed - but management did not bother to clean it. This hotel needs a good cleaning and some minor repairs. Good side: 1 block from Broadway Street - 2 blocks to subway and about 3 blocks to the Greyline stop - Time Square (a must). I felt very safe walking around the area.

Reviews.Title: “No Problem with The Mayfair Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaFatz
Reviews.Content: I dont understand why other people had a problem with this hotel. It was exactly what we were looking for - a place to stay with a great location. This hotel is situated right in the heart of Times Square - perfect. The room was small but clean - what else do you need in New York - whos going to be spending time in their room when there's a wonderful city to be seen!! The staff were very friendly and even organised a lift for us to the airport - whisch was cheaper than a yellow cab and was ready for us at the exact time we asked. We are going to stay there again next June.

Reviews.Title: “comparing to NY rates- great value!”
Reviews.Author: iditharari
Reviews.Content: we atayed at the hotel for a week last month (2couples 2 rooms). defenetley a great location for a first time tourist to NY, practicly on times squere, close to everything. the place is small, about 60-79 rooms, which makes it freindly. true, it doesn;t have a lot of facilieties and the lobby is small, but the workers were very freindly and helpfull. iur room (queen) was nice, clean great bathroom. the other room (double) was much smaller and had bad low water pressure problem that wasn't fixed althogh many promises were made. all and all- comparing to outrages rates of NYC it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BigcatVirginia
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were wonderful. Very comfortable bed. The room was small but, what do people expect for the price. The location is so convienent to all theaters and Times Square. A most WONDERFUL experience!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magic!”
Reviews.Author: AdamheartsNY
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at the Mayfair Hotel in New York for a week over New Year, in December 2007 and it has took a while for me to write a review but I just had to give my input... Whether it is because it has always been my dream to go to America, particularly New York, and loving every minute of it possibly blinded by the magic I don't know but I thought it was a cute, special little place. The location CANNOT BE BEAT! Period! So that in itself is enough to give this place top marks. And the beds and mountains of cushions were very confortable. Anyway, I certainly wasn't going to let a pokey little ratty lift, and small rooms put a hump in my "vacation"! Normally I would notice silly things like that, but this time every little thing just added to the splendor of it all. Sitting in the funny little room with fantastic toile wallpaper and matching cushions and curtains, the windows with oh so NYC fire escape stairs leading down, Oprah on the ancient little 80's TV, with a matching 80's time capsule of a safe on the wall nearby, eating my Cheetos and Baby Ruth, I freaking loved it. And heading down every morning and evening, all wrapped up from the cold, out of the hotel through the character rich "lobby" lined with photos of all the greats Fred Astair, Frank Sinatra, Charlie Chaplin, Marlene Dietrich was just magical. So get down of your high horses you miseries, the place is exactly as you would imagine it from the website etc. However, we did have a nice corner room which had two windows, although there was nothing but black holes out of each of them, but again I loved that!...sitting on the window sill with my Starbucks Gingerbread latte, having a very sneaky cigarette, wating for Batman to pop up any second...! It's what you make of it I say. If you want gloss and luxury, get yourself to The Plaza or The Carlton, or there is even a vacuous Hilton a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hokie69
Reviews.Content: Mayfair Hotel is a nice little place located in the heart of New York's theater district. In fact Spring Awakening was playing right next door and Chicago was right across the street. Broadway is a very short walk to the corner and Times Square is only 3 blocks farther. You cannot beat the location! The hotel itself is nothing to brag about. The lobby needs a major uplifting as it only has the check in desk and a few table and chairs. Only one elevator serves guests and it is very small - barely big enough for 2 people and their luggage. Check in was easy and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The rate we got on Priceline was $230 but I found out later I could have gone directly to the hotel and got a rate of just over $200. Our room was very small but had a king size bed with a temperpedic mattress that was very comfortable. The room was clean but we did bump into each other walking around and the bathroom was teeny but had a good shower. No amenities were in the room except for an ironing board and iron. 19" TV only had 30 channels. We were happy with our stay here because the price was pretty good, the location was great, and the room was clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would probably stay here again. It reminded me of some of the hotels where I have stayed in Europe. Just basic small rooms with no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves!”
Reviews.Author: cgoloff
Reviews.Content: Litigation in the works. Billed my credit card AFTER I cancelled online and by phone 2 weeks before stay. NEVER a return call. Employees actually pretend not to speak english when they hear a complaint. Stopped by the lobby before my stay: FILTHY! This place is not basic - it is a PIT.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: cjrossy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mayfair hotel for four and a half weeks in April/ May 2008 while on a business trip to New York. The hotel is extremel basic. No tea or coffee making facilities in the bedrooms. There is a very small reception area with the hotel providing very few facilities on site. Rooms vary in size but some can be extremely small. Decor and furnishings are very dated although the daily cleaning was commendable. One could'nt help wonder why the hotel had not been given a paint "spruce up" as this really could make such a difference to the appearance both externally and internally. What this hotel has got going for it is it's great location, especially if you are on a short break and time is of the essence. The Mayfair is located right in the heart of the theatre district and is literally around the corner from Times Square. Sight seeing to the likes of Top of the Rock or Empire State Building, Cinemas, Broadway shows, shopping, restaurants and Central Park are all within easy walking distance. If you are visiting the wonderful but hectic city of New York for a few days on a budget basis and want to be in the heart of the action and will accept basic accomodation standards then this place will probably do. If you enjoy average to high accomodation standards as part of your trip or holiday you may be best to look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for Travelers on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: ChelleVel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayfair for 2 nites, May 24 and May 25, 2008. I would rate this hotel 2 stars. This is no Waldorf Astoria, but if you're looking for a hotel with very BASIC necessities in an EXCELLENT location, close to shops and subways, this is the place for you. Now I'd have to say NYC hotels tend to be VERY overpriced. Traveling by myself, I was looking to spend the least amount of money as I possibly could on a hotel, without compromising certain things which I consider must haves, for example, hotels must be in a SAFE area, and I look for private baths in the room (no shared bathroom for me). This was the only hotel that I found under $200 a night that fit that discription. Now 200 dollars is VERY overpriced for this particular hotel, but for NYC, 200 dollars is considered a bargain, so if you travel to NYC and you just want a place to lay your head at night and to shower in the mornings, this is the place for you. I expected the world's tiniest room. I was right. The room was VERY tiny. But it had just what I needed, a tv, a tiny bathroom and a twin sized beds. The room looked like it was made for a dwarf! Barely any room to walk in and I looked at a double room and it was tiny as well. But what you will come to see is that most buildings/rooms in NY are very small. If you're looking to spend a lot of time in your hotel and/or room, I would not recommend this hotel. Will I ever stay again? If I was staying for 1 or 2 nights, yes, anything more than that, no, I don't think I can handle the tight space for more than 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Think we'll give it a miss!”
Reviews.Author: sandie1947
Reviews.Content: Okay, I actually haven't stayed at the Mayfair yet.. The reservation is for July, but did have an opportunity to check it out this past w/e while in NYC for another short vacation. Hmmm, nice location and very regal from the outside. The 'lobby' is something else. The guys behind the desk were actually getting dressed while I was talking with them about seeing a room. YES, putting on their 'official' long-sleeved spandex shirts! The elevator was horrible. The rug is old and curled around the edges with only enough room for two people. The room he showed me looked NOTHING like the one in the brochure that he had just handed me. The room was dim and obviously had a window, but it was covered up with a heavy drape. My cousins and I enjoy sitting in the lobbies of hotels after a long day of walking and sightseeing. Given that I had an opportunity to view this place ahead of time, I think that we'll change our reservations. The other two spots we've stayed in the past were amazing. The Roosevelt and the Hudson; this is a dump compared to these two.

Reviews.Title: “The MAYFAIR IS WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: lilllulu
Reviews.Content: First trip to NYC...found "The Mayfair" online, read the reviews, called and booked the hotel directly. Great place to stay, reasonably priced, beautiful Catholic Church accross the street, St Malachi's (the actor's chapel), a theatre next door and one accross the street where we saw "Chicago". There is a grocery store on the corner, 1/2 block from Broadway. Everything is easily accessible, even the subway. Our room was comfortable, the staff was helpful....we had a great time right in the heart of everything! We will return to NYC and stay at the Mayfair!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: jmoney1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before boarding a cruise ship for the Caribbean. I had never been to NY before so I wanted to stay in the heart of everything. I picked the perfect place!! It was near the corner of W 49th & Broadway and as soon as I turned the corner, there were all the lights of Broadway!!! So the room wasnt huge, it was enough for me. It has a very nice European feel and several of the guests stayed up and in the lobby drinking and talking, very comfortable atmosphere. I did notice a $3 charge on my credit card bill after, not sure what that was for, but it was worth it!!! We will def be back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the theatre district”
Reviews.Author: TofHh20town
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel right in the theatre district! Just a few blocks from Times Square, but far enough so that the room was nice and quiet. Great resturants in the neighborhood. The room was small, but clean and nice. A great value for travellers who are planning on seeing shows and staying busy, but not spending a lot of time in their room. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. We had to arrive before check-in time, and the staff checked our luggage so we could attend a matinee at a local theatre. Once our show was over and we returned to the theatre, we were all checked in and our luggage was brought to our room. The staff provided curb side service, and arranged for our transportation to the airport the morning we left. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out with your credit card”
Reviews.Author: MNCFOX
Reviews.Content: Be careful with this one. We stayed there for one night in September and imagine my surprise when they not only charged my credit card for the one night, but they made a second charge for an additional $375! I am still fighting them to get my $$ back. I have contacted them but gotten no response. Make sure you watch your charges with this place!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: 4641brian
Reviews.Content: We read several reviews on this hotel and noticed the moans about the small rooms and yep they weren't the biggest but hey your in New York, why do you want to spend time in your room-New York is on the door step! The hotel has an excellent location, just off broadway, near the tube station to get you any where you want, near Times Square not far from anything really. One thing about the hotel is dont expect luxury, the rooms were in decent enough condition, clean, warm, safe and modern-ish. However the reception, stairs and hallways could do with abit of a refurb-dated and worn! We found a crackin wee cafe on the corner of 7th ave and 50th street for breakfast, Majestic Cafe-had breakfast there most days!

Reviews.Title: “When you just need a safe, convenient place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: VermontDaddio
Reviews.Content: If you want a big, fancy room with a stunning view of the city - don't stay here! I have to laugh at the reviewers who give brutal reviews to cheap hotels for being... CHEAP! Of course you are going to end up in a small room with dated furniture if you are paying $150/night in Manhattan! I'm giving the Mayfair New York a score of 4/5 in relation to the VALUE (the cost vs. my needs) for a midtown Manhattan hotel. I would obviously not give the same review if I paid $500/night for the same room. The Mayfair New York is safe and located in an unbelievably central location in the Theater District. Walk a half block east from the front door of the hotel - and look at the lights of Times Square. Walk a half block west from the front door of the hotel - and grab breakfast at a great diner on 8th Avenue. There is an internet cafe just a few doors down, and another just a block away. A gym is 2-3 doors down. Walk just about any direction for a block or two, and you will hit a subway station. You just can't beat the convenience. The property itself is dated and a little beat up, but that stuff just doesn't bother me. The desk staff and manager were friendly enough, and my room was just what I needed... a safe, clean, comfortable bed to sleep in. My room was tiny, but I expected it. It is a "double", but their online reservation system will only show that room if you say that "1" guest is staying. If you enter "2", it will only show queen rooms. The wallpaper, curtains, and pillows are all decked out in toile (check out the pictures) - which is cheesy and charming at the same time. I thought it was fun. My room was on the second floor and looked into a shaft (no view). This actually worked out fine for me, because my room was quiet (no street noise) and stayed dark in the morning so I could sleep in a bit. My only advice is to make sure the window is locked. I didn't check until the second night, and it was closed - but unlocked. I don't know if anyone can get access to the shaft, but if so, it would be easy to climb into the 2nd floor window. Of course, it is smart to always check the locks on windows at your hotel - wherever you stay. I stayed the night of St. Patrick's Day (March 18) and the following two nights. I paid $162 for the first night and $150 each for the following two nights. I couldn't find any room in midtown with a private bath for a better deal for those days... including properties with lower reviews. If you don't need "fancy" and you have a sense of humor about your accomodations - you will love the Mayfair New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cozzy”
Reviews.Author: gsx2004
Reviews.Content: I have read many reviews about this hotel. Many bad ones and I for one would have to say that for it being N.Y.C. I thought the hotel was great. Its in the heart of the theatre district. Across the street from *CHICAGO* and 1 block from all of times square. Its basically on broadway. We walked all of times square and thru alot of great resturants and stores. Its also 1 block away from a subway station that gets the 1 train for you guys who want to go down to the financial district or to catch the south ferry its very convinient. The rockerfeller center and radio city music hall are down the street if you like to walk. Central park is up a few blocks but besides that i dont know what else to say. The staff were super polite and helped us even getting a car(lincon towncar) to the airport for cheeper than what a cab drover quoted us. Rooms were fairly small but all we did was go there to sleep and shower so unless you are planning to stay in your room for long periods of time i would give it an a+++.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: gigglygertie
Reviews.Content: We arrived and walked into reception and was totally ignored by the receptionist. After attracting her attention (although she was sat doing nothing) she rudley booked us in. At this point we were dismayed but thought hey it cannot be that bad. We were told to wait and after about 10 mins we were given our room key and dismissed. The room was so small you could only just walk around the bed, the bathroom was bigger. Everything in the hotel was shabby, dingy and dark. Like a cheap BB on a back street somewhere grim You had to pay $2 dollars each a day to store your suitcase. We were flabbergasted I can tell you. I was upset as this holiday was a treat for my friends '40' and I wanted it to be special. . She said dont worry we will only be sleeping here, its not that bad. We went out for a reccy of the area, on return we asked if we could get some drinks " oh yes of course you can go out the hotel turn left and there is a coffee shop" Unbelieveable.! No drinks or tea/ coffee making facilities in the hotel. At this point we checked out!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - charming and clean”
Reviews.Author: pcm501
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for a girls weekend - traveling with my teenage daughter and a friend, we got a room with a "futon". Though certainly not roomy, we found it clean, nicely decorated, front desk staff friendly and very helpful, and its location, near Times Square, and metro, perfect. Understanding the relative cost of other rooms in Manhatten near this location, and having stayed in worse digs for more money, we actually found it better than expected. I believe we got sat. night for 160 and Sun night for 140 - on President's Day weekend... Our room, on the third floor - 304 actually - faced 49th street right in front of the Actors Chapel - lovely catholic church. If you can request a front facing room - do that.

Reviews.Title: “Mom and I had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: ttoniolo
Reviews.Content: My mom took me to New York for a Christmas shopping trip in December of 2007! We had a great time but it went way to fast! Thanks again Mom for the awesome trip.... Now - about "The Door" as we like to call it! As this seemed to be the only picture we could find of the place on the internet! The Mayfair was in a perfect location for shoppers and show goers who would rather save their money for shopping. Our room was very small, but the bathroom was clean and bright and the staff were very friendly! Make sure you like the person you are travelling with or things could get a little crowded - good thing I was travelling with my Mom and not my husband - LOL. So, to recap - the Mayfair is cheap (considering the location), small rooms, bright and clean bathrooms and great staff! If you're looking for a Ritz Carlton or a Trump Tower - this is not the place for you! But if you're looking for a reasonable priced room and are not planning on spending too much time in it - call the Mayfair! Oh and try to make it to PAX for lunch - oh yeah, and Strawberry for some good deals on woman clothes!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be :-(”
Reviews.Author: WineTraveller
Reviews.Content: We used to stay here a number of times in the 90's when we would visit NYC to see the shows. We loved the great price for the phenomenal location at a neat boutique hotel. Recently, I forgot to make reservations at our regular hotel and we ended up at the Mayfair. Lordy, how things have changed! The prices were still relatively decent, but the hotel hadn't been updated in ten years, or even CLEANED in ten years! The best word to describe the conditions at the Mayfair is "tired." The entire hotel seemed to be in desperate need of being refurbished and renovated. Even with a great price, it'll be a LONG time before we stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hoo Boy!”
Reviews.Author: PattyRI
Reviews.Content: We went in for one night and didn't spend much time at all in the room which was a good thing. The common areas (lobby, elevator) were in dire need of just CLEANING if nothing else. The elevator was a trip all by itself! Room for no more than 2 very small people with no luggage. The brass door had something spilled on it that was probably there for years. The floor was dirty...so dirty that you could actually SEE piles of dirt in the corners. Egads! What had we gotten ourselves into?!! The phone in the room did not work and the staff was less than helpful and in no way concerned that we could not use it. They directed us to a shabby pay phone in the lobby to make our long distance call....! Instead of just allowing us to make one call from the hotel desk. The room itself was one of the smallest I have ever been in. The bathroom was one step up outside of the layer of dust on the light fixtures. The glass door shower had two shower heads, that actually worked! The bed was comfortable and we were glad to pack up and get out in the morning! Patty - Rhode Island

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Not_real_name_8
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive but clean European-style boutique hotel a couple of blocks.from Times Square. I booked a king bed with a single pull-out for around $150 per night, including tax., through the hotel's website. I was expecting a tiny room after reading other user reviews on sites like this, and was surprised to find that our room was a decent size for a NY hotel, though I'm certain we must have had one of the larger rooms. Sure, the wallpaper (what IS that style and why would anyone pick it?) was kind of overwhelming, but I prefer bad taste to no taste. The real pleasant surprise, however, was the bathroom, which featured dark green marble or something like it, with a glass-enclosed tub and large wall mirror and counter separate from the sink mirror. It was bigger than some NY hotel bathrooms that I've seen, including at heavyweights like the Waldorf Astoria and the Essex House., and trendy boutique hotels like Morgans on Madison and City Club on 44th. AgaIn, I don't think that this was the mean, since it looked nothing like the black-and-white tiled bathrooms in some of the photos on this site. My only complaint was that the street noise woke me up in the middle of the night, but hey, if you want peace and quiet, Times Square is the wrong place.

Reviews.Title: “solid budget hotel with some charm”
Reviews.Author: loveslife
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York a half dozen times a year for work and need to find hotels that are clean, safe, comfortable, and affordable. The Mayfair fit that perfectly. Rooms are very small--I had a queen standard and can't imagine two people sharing this space. The rooms are well organized however, clean , with good beds and bedding, and nice bathrooms . The location is perfect and if you are not looking for a "hotel experience" this is a solid choice. Yes the elevator is small and dowdy--and this is a place to sleep --but I like it and would return again . It's hard to find a hotel under $200 in New York that is not creepy or depressing. This one is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; modest hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashlander
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to subway, theatre, restaurants. The first room I got was pretty bad--very small and the bathroom seemed swarmy--some mold between tiles. I asked for a different room which they accommodated and was much happier. Room was extremely small but overall pleasant enough and bathroom was OK. Bedding was comfortable. With some upgrades this hotel could be a great value. Staff was quite pleasant although not the best source for restaurant recommendations--for authentic New York pizza they directed us to Sbarro and another fast food place!

Reviews.Title: “Good value/location spoilt by sneaky credit card charge”
Reviews.Author: grazza1977
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel 4 stars for it's location, value and helpful staff (well night porter anyway!). However, 1 week after returning to the UK I spotted a $15.00 charge on my credit card made by the Mayfair Hotel; this was odd because we had no bill to settle on checkout. I emailed eBookers, who informed me that the hotel had decided to charge us a "Gas and Electricity surcharge"! Naturally they have requested that the Mayfair refund me. I thought this was particularly sneaky as a lot of people may not notice or question such a charge. If you do stay here, please check what "surcharges" there may be (and refuse to pay them) and of course check your statement when you return.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the discount price I got”
Reviews.Author: paintedwood
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay at the Mayfair. All in all it was a good experience. There were many positives but also some negatives. I was able to book the room for a great price which made it worth it. There were five of us traveling so we booked two rooms. One with a pull out bed and a queen size bed. The other with just a queen size bed. When we first walked into the room, we couldn't believe how small it was. The pull out couch was smaller than a twin size, it was like a stretcher! Thank goodness it was for a 10 year old and she seemed fine. We usually stay in someones apartment when we go to New York and this was our first time in a hotel. My kids are used to larger rooms and really couldn't get over the fact that the rooms were so small. I was beginning to think they've been just spoiled all these years. I had been reviewing many hotels and frequent comments stated small rooms. It must just be New York. Anyway, everything was clean. The bed was comfortable. We all slept well. The boys room faced the alley and was quiet all night. The "girls" room faced the street and was quite noisy. Lots of sirens when we first went to bed. Didn't bother me, though, I love the sounds when I'm in the city! It is also in such an awesome location. You just can't beat it. Next time I need a place in New York I will definitely try to book a room....if I can get it for the same price, I'll book it. If I have to pay there regular price, I will probably pass, not enough amenities for the full price.

Reviews.Title: “once is more than enough”
Reviews.Author: pearlieshell
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 days and everyday of our stay we were promised that the airconditioning, safe and the window lock would be fixed......they turned out to be unfulfilled promises. The lift is small and takes forever. Be prepared to walk most of the time.The hotel is old and pretty run down. The only thing it had was position but then we also stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown and that has position and everything the Mayfair lacks!The last straw was when we found we had to pay for leaving our luggage with them until our evening flight.....we stayed in ten hotels on this trip and the Mayfair was the only one that charged!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: austinkisses
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to New York to celebrate our anniversary. We needed a place that was reasonably priced and was close to the attractions. The Mayfair is just that. The employees at the Mayfair were very friendly and helpful. It is right there in the mix of Broadway shows, Time Square, David Letterman Show, etc. It is small, but I have no complaints. Our bed was sooooo comfortable. The down comforter was so cuddly and soft. It was great to hop into after a long day of walking around the city. I would stay at the Mayfair again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: abbeygirl_7
Reviews.Content: One week before thanksgiving makes finding an affordable room in NYC a challenge. Stayed for just one night (few hours really!)as out enjoying shopping and great nightlife. Yes the room was small and the hotel is unique not like all other big, shiney hotels, but the bed was comfortable, the staff on the desk great- advised us of a nice lobster restaurant when we would have walked into a chain. Definately would stay again as it is right in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic nyc budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ienjoyagoodcitybreak
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, i have to be honest, this place looked like those scarey hotels you see on films where shortly after checking in you are robbed and all your belongings stolen!! after a very comfortable nights sleep we woke up to a very chintzy room and realised what a perfect little place this is! right in the heart of theatre-land, perfect for the subway, central park and times square. the beds are comfortable, rooms very clean and have everything you could need for a stay in this wonderful city. look beyond the tired wallpaper and rickity old lift find very helpful staff, a perfect location and an overall fantastic value for money hotel. and dont worry about the small-ness of the rooms, you really wont be in your room much- far too much to see and do outside!

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: Beans and Cornbread
Reviews.Content: I asked for a queen bed, received a twin. The room size was INCREDIBLY small and suffocating. I had two windows smashed up against brick walls. I kind of knew all this going in but I didn't think it'd be this depressing! I stayed here for two days. During this time I did not shower because there wasn't any hot water up on floor 6, or at least none in my room. The sink also became clogged if you ran the water more than a dribble. The place was clean but felt dirty. The tv was the size of a pebble. Bottom line, for close to 300.00, this place sucked and I will never be back. Hopefully I will not have to do business in the Times Square area ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price in the Theater District”
Reviews.Author: guiltfree
Reviews.Content: I go to NY for the theaters and restaurants every year and this is where I love to stay. It is the least expensive hotel that is up to my standards. It is very clean, they are very courteous and attentive, but if you want a big fancy room it may not be up to yours. The bed almost takes up the entire room (I get the same room whenever I can), but I'm not in there except to sleep and I travel alone. And the bed is really comfortable. You can't get a better location for theaters. And the subways are right on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Skaternerd
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in a desperate search for a room for a work trip. No hotels were taking the corporate rate, in fact most were charging double that rate. Other hotels in my price range featured shared bathrooms. I found this hotel's website and discovered that it had an "online special" for a twin (!) bed for $192 per night. I booked it thinking, "well, it's only for one night and at least I'll have my own bathroom." I wasn't expecting much. I found though, a very friendly and accommodating staff, a very clean room (with a queen sized bed), a very clean bathroom, and amenities like a computer in the room. The room was small, and there was very little drawer and closet space, but given the location (just off Broadway on 49th), and my short stay, it was perfect. It will probably be the first place I'll look if I again find myself in NYC for work.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION...but...”
Reviews.Author: stylerchick
Reviews.Content: the location of the Mayfair can NOT be beat! right across the street from Chicago, 1 1/2 blocks from the R subway ( which we took everywhere). but, it's 106 yrs old, and it shows. since it was our anniversary, we asked for a nice room. after cramming 2 of us and 2 suitcases into the only elevator ( the size of a small closet), we got to our room, which was claustrophobic, to say the least, and the A/C didn't work. i knew i couldn't spend 3 nites here, so we called, and got a room change. this was about 3:15, and check in was 3, so i was surprised to hear that they'd assigned all the larger rooms. we got room 401...even tinier, a FULL bed, not the queen they promised, and 2 windows ( one in the bath--very grubby lookin floor in the shower :( ) that overlooked a brick wall about 4 ft away. we literally didn't know if it was day or nite! but, watching the pigeons was interesting... the room had a comp. computer, but we couldn't access AOL, and after repeated calls, we figured they didn't care if we could or not. we checked out sunday AM, and they required the we pay to store our luggage then, rather than later, and seemed to not be concerned when we arrived @ 5:30 PM to head to the airport that the person w/ the combination to the luggage room wasn't there.( the reason for the prepay?) when we asked if we could cash a check to pay for our cab, they said they didn't do that. WHAT? Finally, we got our luggage, and found our own cab and headed for the airport. would i stay there again? dunno.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: eartone
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel for the price. Steps away from Times Square and in the middle of the theatre district. Yes, the room was small, but it was comfortable. The bathroom was fine- elevator VERY small, but it works. Staff very congenial. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flajune1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband & I have stayed at this hotel. The general concensus is that for the price, you can't beat this hotel. And I have to agree whole heartedly. It is so conveniently located. Many people have reviewed the hotel and complained about the noisy air conditioning, small rooms & old elevators. But, my feeling is that you're not staying there for these reasons. You're staying for the convenience to all that New York has to offer. My husband & I love NY and we would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Xpress18
Reviews.Content: So I was a bit skeptical about staying here, because many of my friends say Im a little high maintenance for this hotel. But I absolutely loved it. I went to NYC in April 2007 on my 20th birthday. I arrived on my birthday and well as soon as we got there Bruce the doorman was very helpful and took our luggage for my friend and I. We had a little mishap when we first arrived but everything got fixed right away. Then we got to our room. We expected it to be small but being from California I had never seen a room that small. Despite the small room it was very clean couldnt have asked for more. To top it off they had asked at the front desk why we were visiting and we told them for my birthday. After being in our room for 20 minutes we opened our door and Bruce the doorman and other staff had a cupcake with candles lit. It was nice and at any other hotel I wouldnt have had this experience. They were extremely nice and helpful I recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay in Midtown, I recommend the Mayfair. Yes, rooms are very small - my single was probably 150sf - and it is an older hotel, and the decor has not been updated in a long time. My room was fine for one person - bathroom was large enough, the a/c worked well, and most importantly for me, everything was very clean. The hotel is right in the middle of the theatre district, a 5-minute walk from Times Square. There are two subway stations within two blocks, and you can walk to the Port Authority. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful all during my stay. It's not luxury, but it is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel Hidden in Bustling NYC”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter8556
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Mayfair for four days last October. The hotel is quiet small and the advertised restaurant that was supposed to be adjacent to the hotel was no longer in business. Those negatives aside the Mayfair was perfect for what we needed. We went to New York as sightseers and so we did not need a really plush room like at the Ritz since we planned on being gone most of the day looking at attractions. Even though our room was incredibly small, the bed was a full and very soft and the sheets were quiet nice. The entire hotel is covered with old photographs of movie stars such as Clark Gable and Frank Sinatra. I thought this gave it a very nice upscale feel despite the size of the hotel. As far as location goes it was absolutely perfect. Very close to the Theatre district and only a couple of blocks away from Times Square. There is a subway station only a block away from the entrance to the hotel which was wonderful for exploring the city. Overall it was a great little hotel that most people have never heard of for a very reasonable price (by NYC standards). I would recommend the Mayfair for couples who are planning on coming to NYC primarily as tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: salisburytraveler
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, the rooms are most definitely small so if that's an issue for you don't stay here. We had a few small issues when we arrived but the front desk staff was great took care of the problem right away and were all very friendly. We got a great deal on the price. Beds are much more comfortable than most hotels. Free internet access with a computer and printer in the room at no additional cost. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Bruse, the Concierge, is the PRINCE of 49th ST!”
Reviews.Author: nsantoia
Reviews.Content: Just took my first trip to NYC! Had no idea what a great place it is! Reasons to stay at the Mayfair, an older European style hotel: *BRUCE, the concierge, AND the other fabulous staff! *clean although small rooms, private bath *great location in Theater District near Times Square *located close to 3 different subway lines *great value, plus some rooms have computers w/internet *can walk to a multitude of attractions *has an elevator, air conditioning, and a piano in the lobby BRUCE, the CONCIERGE, was a TRAVELER'S BEST FRIEND! Helped us SO many times! Like when we discovered we had the wrong luggage! When we needed directions! When we needed an autograph! When we needed ice! When our room keys suddenly didn't work any more! When we needed to choose a restaurant! When we had a question about ANYTHING! He and the staff made us feel like family whenever we walked in the door! The property could be fixed up a little and could be a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the doorman?”
Reviews.Author: nolayaya
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair website shows a picture of a smiling door man greeting you. Ha! No one smiles there and there's no door man. First the good, extremely comfortable kingsize bed and an a/c unit that worked, our room was actually cold. Both are definite pluses. The room was small and really there was not enough room to open up two suitcases. The bathroom mirror had a huge crack from end to end. It looked like the whole thing was ready to fall off the wall. The shower(no tub) door would only open at one end and that was a struggle. The shower tile looked like it hadn't been cleaned in ages. I put down a towel on the shower floor and left it there the duration of our stay. Almost forgot, the elevator, only one light working and it's filthy. How much effort is it to clean the elevator doors. While waiting for the elevator on the7th floor, we happened to look up the stairs and noticed a tremendous hole in the ceiling. It's a good location, good bed, good a/c. The staff seemed to not care if we were staying there or not, they weren't vey friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Ciould Be A Real Jewel”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: This could be an extremely nice hotel if the management paid attention to the details of the way the place is maintained. The inside guest elevator door looks as though something has spilled on it and was never cleaned off. The light bulbs in the lanterns outside of the front door were both burnt out during my stay. The flower box on the front lobby window had no plants or flowers-not even artificial flowers. This is a tiny little hotel, with tiny little corridors and tiny little rooms. The room decor is a knock off of the early Schraeger-type boutique properties in the City. The guest room was basic and met our sleeping needs. The coordinated Chinoise wall covering and matching bed covers aided in making the best of a room that had a double bed with no more than 24 inches of walking space around it. There are two phones in the room and a decent radio should you opt out of viewing television. A word of caution, the thermostat on the wall does not control the room air conditioner. For that you must use a separate remote control. The bathroom was large, when considering the size of the guest room. The lighting was functional and the water pressure in the shower was good. The mini shampoo bottles were made of such rigid plastic that it was nearly impossible to get any product out of them. The hotel is conveniently located near multiple subway lines that can get you to virtually any area in the metropolitan area. The closest subway is west of the hotel at Eight Avenue (north bound for cars) and Broadway (south bound for cars); you can catch the 8th Avenue subway from either Penn Station or Port Authority should you be arriving by train, bus or airport connections. There is a parking garage right at 49th and 8th Avenue; but, I would be very afraid to guess how much the nightly charge may be. There is an intranet cafe next door and you can catch up on your emails should you not be traveling or being weighted down with a laptop. And most interesting of all, the hotel is immediately adjacent to this year's Tony Award recipient of the Best Musical. If you are a theater junky, this place is your ground zero.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant and Enjoyable/GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: baritone77
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I have to admit I was a little skeptical about staying here. But quickly changed my mind after check in. We arrived kindof late (about 10:00 at night), but the clerk behind the desk was very helpful and quick to get us checked in and settled. The lobby is very nicely done with a piano in the corner (we even had a young lady play a few songs for us while we were there). The elevator is EXTREMELY small, but that's to be expected in older hotels. It was not as slow as some of the reviews I read, but it's also not the fastest i've been on. Now, to the rooms. It was VERY SMALL and the print on the walls, curtains and headboard was a bit much, but otherwise, the room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable and the hot water worked just fine. There is a small TV with a few channels and highspeed internet (although we didn't bring a computer with us). There was a window that opened to a fire-escape and a brick wall, so the view was not the best.. but the window locked and we felt completely safe. The air-conditioning was a bit loud, but nothing we couldn't sleep through. The location is FANTASTIC. Spring Awakening was playing in the theater right next door to the hotel..literally, 5 steps and you are there. The Gerswhin Theater (WICKED!) was right around the corner, and other theaters (you are in the theater district) are just a few short steps away.. Times Square and all the other "touristy" things are just a short walk away. Not to mention numerous resturants, shops, etc. (we recommend Heartland Brewery on 51st street). Overall, our stay was wonderful. Keep in mind, if you are looking for large rooms, room service, and a mint on the pillow, then keep looking.. but, if you are looking for a nice, clean, safe place to rest your head after a day of sigh-seeing, then I highly recommend this hotel... you can't beat it for the price :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Regrettable Experience - Terrible”
Reviews.Author: DMAEM
Reviews.Content: The sub-par hotel will do you no favors in any regard - you are on your own for everything. Expect nothing but indifference and incompetence from staff. No managers in sight. Rooms are claustrophobic - that's generous. The reason I will never stay here again is due to the room's smoke alarm that went off inexplicably - it required me and others to check out of the hotel - at 4 AM. They refused any sort of even partial refund.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TEcho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mayfair New York seven nights. We had a queen bed, which was comfortable. But it was difficult to find space to store our luggage in the small room. The floor severely sagged toward one corner--enough that it caused me to stumble on a couple of occasions. During the recent renovation, they were unable to fix these structural problems. The view outside the window was of a nasty brick wall about five feet away. There is a fire department station around the corner, and we heard firetruck sirens every night. The bathroom facilities were adequate, but with very limited storage area. It would take several minutes to get hot water in the shower. Fortunately, our room had a water temperature gauge on the shower control, so we could tell at a glance when the water got hot. A wall-mounted blow dryer was available, but it often would not work on the high setting. The computer with internet connection and printer were handy resources to have available. I found using hopstop.com was very helpful in finding the right subway trains and connections to take to specific destinations, especially on the weekend when some trains do not operate. The built-in computer had two USB ports on the front, but the ports seem to be out of alignment with the case, for I could not get my flashdrive to insert. Every time the computer was rebooted, all settings were reset, including the sound level, which always came on too loud. Since I was previously told that not all rooms have computers, but they all are supposed to have internet connections, I took along my laptop to ensure that I had a computer resource. In this room, however, it would have been very difficult to plug a cable into the ethernet jack, as the jack was located behind a panel that was installed to deter theft of the LCD monitor. The digital wall safe had ample room for small items, but not large enough for my laptop computer. Fortunately, I had taken along a Kensington lock and found a place to connect it in the room that allowed my laptop to be at least theft-resistant. An iron and ironing board was provided in the room, but no refrigerator, microwave oven, coffee maker, etc. was available. The desk staff did, however, say that they could store small refrigerated items for us, if needed. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful, although the foreign accents of some personnel were not easy to understand. As other reviewers have stated, the price and location are big plusses. There are stations for three different subway lines within a block, and bus routes in all directions are closely available. For these reasons, we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sventhor
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised when we arrived at the Mayfair. Don't expect any really flash, but it is great value when compared to some of the other much pricer hotels we compared in New York. The location is FANTASTIC. 10 mins walk from Times Sqr. Shower didn't work the first night, but they changed our room straight away and gave us a $40 discount off the 1st night room rate (US$160 per night). Bruce the doorman was very helpful, thanks Bruce. The only grip I would have about the place is that the owner is slowly letting it get run down. It is still okay at the moment but I can see the hotel going downhill in the next few years unless some TLC is given to it. And oh, the bar/restaurant next door isn't open anymore.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: tropicfive
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels on TripAdvisor, I narrowed my choice down to the Mayfair. I went to bed, intending to book my Queen room (having been told the dbl was VERY small) the next day...when, much to my surprise the rates had gone up $40/night for the same dates! I called the hotel directly, talked to the manager who asked, "how much do you want to pay?" WOW! I named my price (which was the average of the original three night price) and she agreed. Done deal! The Mayfair was quite small with no frills...but spotlessly clean, in a great location, and has a very friendly staff. There is a grocery store/deli right across the street, a Starbucks on the corner, and the Eugene O'Neill Theater next door. The Mayfair's restaurant was closed for renovations, but the front desk recommended a small Italian restaurant 1/2 blk away which was delicious! (Di Marino) My only complaints would be that it took the hot water at least 5 minutes to reach the shower head. After discovering this the first night, we subsequently planned ahead -- turning on the shower five minutes before we wanted in -- but be forewarned! Also, the thermostat in the rooms is preset...and 73 degrees was too warm for my liking. We just turned it off and opened the windows...a little noisy, but in our corner room, we had a nice cool breeze. Certainly these small inconveniences don't detract from the bargain deal at this property. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: simnix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on May 2nd. When they say small rooms , they really mean small rooms. great for one night stays maybe two nights but definitely no longer. Checking in and out were a breeze. near all the theaters and restaurants. Room was clean, good shower. Has all the basic needs. We got it for $140 a night, not sure I would stay there if had to pay much more but as the other reviews say, great location.

Reviews.Title: “totally doable”
Reviews.Author: dwiteshrute
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a small place, with small rooms. But, we were totally comfortable during our two night stay and the front desk took care of our needs. This isn't one of those big hotels with wide hallways and a pool and an exercise room. But that's what makes it a good place to stay. It was quiet, clean and the bathroom was nice. The night-time guy was especially helpful, from getting us an extra blanket at an odd hour to telling us which subway line to take to Yankee stadium. The location is superb if you're looking for an affordable place in Times Square. Its an easy walk to just about anything, including restaurant row, just a couple of blocks south and east. The only problem was the lack of Internet access. They provided a computer in the room, but on-line access was down for the two-plus days we were there with no explanation. That's a problem that must be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor communication”
Reviews.Author: redlionLittleRock
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting that had booked our rooms here. I tried to extend the stay for pleasure; this was done over the internet. It was never confirmed. When I called to confirm the desk clerk could not confirm or take care of anything. I called several times prior to my visit to make sure the reservation was correct and that there was only one under my name. I never was given the same answer. After my visit I was charged twice for one night!!! After working with my credit card company and the Better Business Bureau - I was never reimbursed my false charge. Through the Better Business Bureau I was told that "I had been told that I would have needed to cancel my reservation over the internet." Words of caution - they do not know what they are doing and provide incomplete information at your cost!

Reviews.Title: “good experience at the Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: viajare
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC many times, and have stayed in all manner of hotels, from the Hilton to a dive above a pizza shop. The Mayfair is a charming little hotel with more positives than negatives. The location is ideal: right next to the Eugene O'Neill theatre and steps from restaurants, subway and Times Square. But the room was surprisingly quiet; I heard no street noise at all. Yes, the elevator is a little slow, but there are only 7 floors so you don't have to wait that long. My room was tiny, but if you've ever been in a cabin on a cruise ship you know you can survive in a small space. The high ceiling with recessed lighting helped, and there really was plenty of room for my things. I loved the pull-out makeup mirror in the bathroom, and the bed had such nice bedding and was so comfortable I didn't want to get up in the morning. The only real negative I can say is that the hairdryer only blew cool air, but that might have been just the one in my room. The real positive is that I cannot say enough good things about the staff; everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. I most definitely would return to the Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “For the frugal theatergoer”
Reviews.Author: cordeliaj
Reviews.Content: Hotel was basic but good for what I needed. Lobby was shabby but had lovely old photographs of New York performers -- Josephine Baker, Fred Astaire, Lionel Barrymore etc. Room was small but Internet connection worked -- yay! Bed comfy, wish I'd brought earplugs but that's not their fault. I couldn't get the shower to work, so washed my hair in the sink. If you stay here, you may want to test your shower before you take off your clothes...

Reviews.Title: “Give the Mayfair a try”
Reviews.Author: FRANKRAFFA
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair Hotel has been a great hotel because of its location. I have stayed there various times in the past and have loved the proximity to Broadway(1/2 of an avenue). it is located across the street from a great food store and there is a Catholic church right across the street. In the past, the rooms that I have had(the cheapest) were so small that I felt like I was going to suffocate. This time, I had a "queen" size bed in a very comfortable room. The plusses: there was a wall safe that was able to accommodate my laptop(very important for me!) and the bathroom was immaculate. The bed was very comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The negatives-there is no coffee service at all, either at the front desk or in the rooms. The room that I was in (411) had no heat. I had to use a portable heater which worked well, however, I can't believe that they continue to rent out the room without heat. The toilet flushed fully every five flushes. When I mentioned the heat issue(they could not have missed it, because it was freezing in the room) they did offer to move me to an adjoining room, but I didn't want to pack and unpack again. I cannot emphasize the proximity to subway lines(going directly to the train station) and to Broadway. In addition, there is an internet cafÃ© next door, but it is rather expensive(12.50/hr.) There is DSL, but you have to have a laptop. There is no business center in the hotel. in spite of the above negatives, I think that a room with a "queen" bed is workable. Do not expect an expanse of a lobby, nor any type of lounge or breakfast room. I found the best bet for breakfast was the fancy hotel on the corner of 49th and Broadway, where I got a breakfast of two eggs for under $14.00. That's rare in a fancy hotel. Frank Raffa frankraffa@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “mice in da house”
Reviews.Author: hairhero
Reviews.Content: more than one mice in my room......scary,small,gross and gross.

Reviews.Title: “It Serves Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: mickeytor
Reviews.Content: If you're going to New York to shop, see some some shows, and just generally be in the thick of all the tourist stuff, you can't go wrong with this hotel. The location is excellent as it's right in Times Square. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. The bathroom was a good size, with modern fixtures in the shower and sink. And the general atmosphere is quiet and laid back. We didn't hear our neighbors, ever. On the other hand, be warned - the rooms are tiny. In mine there was barely enough space for a bed! Also, there is no such thing as a room with a view. The window looks onto a brick wall and you never get any natural light. (Of course, this can be a bonus if you're looking to sleep off a night of debauchery!!) This is an old hotel, and in keeping with the times, the elevator is tiny and the lobby is dark. Stuff like this appeals to the history buff in me. I spent some quality time waiting for my partner to get ready, by exploring the various photographs, and assorted decor throughout the halls and lobby. Visitors looking to spend some time in their room, or dependant on room service and such, might want to skip this location. Visitors who just want a safe, clean, convenient place to sleep at night - this comes highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting little spot”
Reviews.Author: rnbm
Reviews.Content: Neutral is a good description for this hotel. All hotels in NY seem to be small, this one was average in size. It was old with a tiny elevator and wood decor. It was historic and basically clean. The odd part was the decor. The wallpaper, drapes, pillows, lapshades.. everything in the room was in the same pink/white pattern as the wallpaper. The staff was friendly and the location was great but its not a luxury hotel. You get what you pay for and this hotel was reasonably priced. It was okay... not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Yotuelle
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to try a new Hotel in Times Square since our last experience, but this little Hotel had a well set webpage with all the information. I wasn't disappointed when we arrived. Little Hotel in the heart of Times Square with a great rate, lovely decoration, a tiny elevator, and cozy rooms. My husband and I had a great time, it is very clean, may be a little over decorated rooms, but with a lot of furniture. I recommend this place if you are planning on spending your money in something other than the Hotel. It is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: chriscarm
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite by chance, after having a bad experience with another hotel. We had a taxi drop us in Times Square & decided we would try & find something in that area. After visiting a couple of hotels which we found to be quite expensive, we found this little hotel on 49th Street, just around the corner from Times Square. It's a very quaint little hotel & because they were renovating, they gave the room to us for a discounted price. I don't think we could have found a better hotel for the money ($170 plus tax per night). We stayed for the week of 13th - 20th July, which was quite hot at that time, but the room had the best air conditioning which was a godsend. It also had the most comfortable king size bed & a pull out sofa bed for our 12 year old. There was a good size bathroom & a computer in the room, which normally had internet connection, but due to the renovations the internet was down. But there's an internet cafe right next door. There's no fridge in the room, so it was hard to keep drinks or anything cold in the room. Apart from that & the pink wallpaper, the room was fantastic. Every night we would walk down to Times Square & be in amongst the hustle & bustle. It's also a short walk to Central Park & just around the corner from the Gray Line's Bus Tours main office. The staff couldn't have been any more helpful & did what they could to look after us. I would definitely stay here again & look forward to seeing the place renovated next time we're in New York. Chris & Carmen Perth, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: ascouse
Reviews.Content: A great location. Possibly the smallest hotel room i've ever stayed in....and i'd gotten and upgrade?!! I thought it was expensive for what it was. Clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Great character and location, but....”
Reviews.Author: tofurkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayfair for two nights, based on a rate that averaged approximately $180 per night. The hotel is an old one, and the decor is reminiscent of the 30's and the heyday of Broadway. The hotel is small! My daughter and I are five footers, and we barely fit together in the one elevator with one bag each. Because of the size of the elevator, and because there was only one,we always walked down the six flights of stairs when leaving our room. The room, as could be expected, was also small, with about fourteen inches of room between the bed and the walls. There was a small desk in the corner and a portable television mounted on a shelf above -- cable, but no movie selections. Although high speed internet was advertised, the DSL did not work, and no one was around to look into things. Fortunately, there was a Cyber Cafe two doors down that had great food, and great computer access for a very reasonable price. There seemed to be a restaurant attached to the Mayfair, but it didn't appear to have been open for some time. A bar type area was in the lobby of the Mayfair, but that was not open during the time we were there. If a person is looking to spend downtime in a hotel, this is not the one for him/her. If looking for a place to sleep while spending most of the time exploring, then the Mayfair would be a good choice. The location is excellent. There are two Broadway theatres on the street, and another one a block down. Times Square is a blockand a half away, and Rockefeller Center (the Today Show) about five blocks away. Gray Line Tours is also a block and a half away, and there are at least a dozen restaurants within a two-five minute walk. There is a drug store about two minutes away, and a Starbuck's everywhere you look. The staff was friendly and courteous; the hotel was clean, and the neighborhood fit for walking any time of the day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: joeyddog
Reviews.Content: I just spent 1 night in a double room. The location can't be beat. The lobby is charming, decorated with vintage movie photos on loan from the Museum of the City of NY. The staff was very helpful and charming. The room as indicated in other reviews was tiny but decorated with taste in a toile design-matching walllpaper and spread. Plenty of pillows, a duvet. My problems centered around the bathroom.Sink drain did not work, shower did not work and the tub would not remain filled- therefore, no way to bathe. I would have requested another room but was already unpacked and undressed for the evening with a early AM meeting.However I would definitely stay there again just reserving a larger room and checking everything out before unpacking. BTW, there is a charming french bistro, Pigalle's, around the corner, open 24 hrs, delicious very reasonable food.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of days while on a business trip. It is certainly centrally located but is small, cramped and the rooms are tiny. Or at least the broom cupboard I was given was tiny. When I asked for a larger room they demanded that i pay extra. So, when they say Euro Style, it means small. The tiny bathroom was clean enough although there were years of dirt and grime worn into the shower basin. Yes, the beds are comfortable but don't expect excellent service or large rooms. On their website they boast fresh cut flowers and mahogany furniture. I don't think so. I certainly paid too much for too little and would not consider staying there again - I'm sure i could find a bigger room for a better price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “merits a repeat visit”
Reviews.Author: Teresa75
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a room with a king sized bed. It was clean, comfortable, and a reasonable size. The bathroom was wonderful. Glass enclosed tub/shower with marble walls and floors and a window. Lots of mirror. The staff was courteous and very helpful and honest. Considering the constant rain when we were there (over 4 days) we found the public areas clean and comfortable. The location is great- close to all the show, within walking to some super restaurants and safe. It is not the "Ritz", rather is is a small "boutique" hotel with prices to match.

Reviews.Title: “They Just Don't Care”
Reviews.Author: AlanBrochstein
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! I lived in NYC for 8 years and have stayed in many, many hotels since I left 12 years ago. I consider myself one who isn't very picky, but there were just too many issues here. First, having access to the internet is very important to me. The hotel promised me that they offered DSL, but it has been broken all month. While the manager blames it on the service provider, an employee explained to me that the hotel is too cheap to put in a reliable solution. To their credit, they did reimburse me for an expense from an internet cafe, but I really missed being able to look up information from the comfort of my room. My wife wants me to mention that the toilet paper was the roughest she has ever experienced. It sure fit in with everything else! While some reviewers on this site and others have praised the hotel in the past for its service, we found the staff to be inattentive at best. In what was almost funny, my wife called down to the front desk to ask for information about an address. The person said "you'll have to look it up on Mapquest". While I don't expect that they will always have the answer, this was like throwing salt on a wound given the lack of internet access despite it being promised. In general, we were shocked over the five days to see the staff seldom greet us. Often, they were engaged in conversation with each other and refused to even glance. One morning, I heard them all complaining about the manager and about how much they hated working for him. While some may complain about the room's size, ours was quite adequate for the $200 a night we were paying. It had a king-sized bed. It even had a computer, though that was rather useless given the lack of internet! The bathroom was marble and had plenty of space. With that said, there were so many examples of disrepair. First, there were missing light fixtures or improper light bulbs. There were other examples of poor maintenance that were just shocking. The shower door, a glass slider, was in such bad condition that I had to open and close it for my wife. Even outside the room, there were signs of deferred maintenance. The posts on the stairs were all quite loose, for instance. We had a great time despite our annoyance with the hotel. I would stay at the Paramount again for the same price, despite the fact that their king rooms are even smaller. For my next trip, I will definitely NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Dump, Filthy and Unpleasant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be inspected by the state/city. Once you enter you are greetted by an unwelcome lobby area with dirt and mud tracks all over. Continue to the tiny elevator, that you can hardly breathe in. Maximum capascity two! The elevator doors were filled with grime. The room was extremely small. The DSL did not work throughout my entire four (4) day stay. What a disaster! The faucet located on the pedistal sink was broken and did not have cold water. My shower door was cracked and I had to left the door to have it closed half way while taking a shower. What a way to lodge! This was an unbelievable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great LITTLE place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough good things about this hotel. It is in a great location, very close to Time Square and Rockefeller Center. The rooms are nice, very small, but nice. They have a great charm about them. It is a perfect place for a couple. You wont want to take a family here but if you are with a significant other it is terrific. The beds are so comfotable it was hard for me to get up once I laid down. All in all I enjoyed my stay here tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,Clean, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 days of business and recreation in NYC. We found this hotel to perfectly meet our needs. The facility itself is clean and well maintained. The room was attractively decorated and very clean, notable in a New York hotel in this price range. The bathroom was stocked with the usual amenities: blow dryer, toiletry products,nice towels without that 'budget' feel. The closet was adequate with lots of wooden hangers,extra pillows and blankets! But the best part was the bed! It had a padded headbaord done in toile to match the wallpaper,complete with duvet cover and huge Euro style pillows. The matress and linens were just about the nicest I've slept on,short of perhaps the Helmsly Palace. The room and the elevator were tiny.No surprise there.The staff were heplful anf friendly. The location was convenient to Times Square and the theatre district,subway stops and a cybercafe just nextdoor. We were a mom and teenage daughter traveling alone and felt safe the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ssh...keep it a secret”
Reviews.Author: erossgoldstein
Reviews.Content: I don't usually stay in NYC as I used to have family there. But I found this place through an online service. It cautioned me that it was small...and it is, but it was just the perfect location. Not only that, it was a lovely, inviting place. We had to wait to get into our room because it was leaking, but the hotel staff gave us another room until the leak was repaired. It is within walking distance to just about everything: subways, busses, Broadway, and just a few blocks from 5th Avenue. We loved our room (once the leak was fixed), which seemed to be newly remodeled. I didn't even miss my bed at home because this was so comfy! The staff was friendly and made you feel at home, welcoming us back from a day of sightseeing or whatever. They had helpful suggestions about where to eat and how to get around. It's like a charming, old world hotel, without the shabbiness. My husband and I have already tried to book this for our next visit (it's too far in the future to do so yet). We worry that it will become too popular for us to get reservations, so keep it under your hat...one of the best kept secrets of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: joannec089
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews of the Mayfair, we were somewhat fearful. Our fears proved groundless. Yes, the room was small. But who comes to New York to spend time in their hotel room? The room was clean; maid service was fine; the hotel staff was friendly and competent. When we complained about a lack of hot water, an employee was at our door within five minutes. ( We simply didn't understand the unusual faucets...) The elevator IS small, but it forces you to communicate with whomever you're rubbing shoulders. The location is wonderful if you're in New York to see theatre. In conclusion, if you're on a budget and can get an Orbitz-type discount,the Mayfair is a perfectly acceptable and charming place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Mayfair - good location, good price (Orbitz)”
Reviews.Author: BridgeTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Mayfair in February. I had gotten a great rate via Orbitz, and the location was ideal (we were seeing several plays). I had upgraded to a "kingsize" room which, while still small, was quite adequate. The bathroom (also small) was apparently recently remodeled. My wife lost her contact down the drain, and the janitor came within 20 minutes and found it for her. The internet connection was up when we arrived, but went down soon after and never came back for two days. The front desk staff was very friendly, but somewhat inept. If you like "european style" (eg, small) hotels, this is a great one. I was somewhat annoyed when we checked out a "fuel surcharge" was added to our bill. Not a lot, but I felt it was kind of bait and switch. Overall though, we liked it a lot and did not experience the service problems others have reported. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a Unique and Wonderful Hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: FLD7
Reviews.Content: After just returning home from a 5-day stay at the Mayfair in NYC, I simply cannot say enough positive things about the hotel. During the past 20 years, I have stayed at enough Manhattan hotels (everything from 2 to 5 star properties) to realize what an splendid and value conscious hotel this is. The room was plush, spacious, clean and comfortable; the marbled bathroom had tons of shelf space; and the amount of lighthing in the room made reading an absolute pleasure. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful and the housekeeping staff most thorough. For the price, location, and quality, it would be difficult to find a better hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This a hotel that, despite the location which is really central, is not worth a penny. Absolutely awful.

Reviews.Title: “Total dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Total Nightmare. First they checked us into a tiny room with a bent front door that looked like it could easily be opened from the outside. We asked for another room and after awhile they gave us a slightly larger room that had not been cleaned. They said they would clean it and we went out. When we got back around 11pm the room still handn't been cleaned. The bed had been made, but the bathroom was still dirty. Dirty in an unmistakable way, but I won't write specifics. We called the front desk and asked them to take care of it. They sent someone up who changed the towels (it is getting very late by this time) but didn't clean at all. We gave up. In the morning we complained and the desk man sounded sympathetic and gave us the managers card. We called looking to give them a chance to try to make it right, but all the general manager Joe Garcia gave us was the runaround and excuses. He charged us full price. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor condition, cleanliness lacking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I booked on the basis of low price, good location and decent reviews, I expected a small room for the price. I did not expect to find the shower dirty (mold + soap scum), the last guest's used soap and shampoo still left behind, cover plates missing from outlets, bulbs missing from lights, toilet not firmly mounted, suspended ceilings with substantial water damage often patched with taped on white cardboard. The water pressure in the shower was excessive, bordering on painful. Also, in addition to the quoted rate, there was a $3 "fuel surcharge." Not a lot of money, but I expect the rate quoted to be what is charged, the govt. taxes and fees already inflate the bill enough, without the hotel sneaking in another $3. This place would be nice if thoroughly remodeled by skilled tradesmen and kept clean. Until then, terrible might be a bit strong, but OK is too generous; I'll take my chances elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but poor in room and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Mayfair from 26/12/05 - 01/01/06 and thought the location was ideal for seeing not just Broadway shows, but centrally located for all of Manhattan and subways to other districts of NYC and Jersey. Unfortunately the service and room was at best poor. The room in the main only gets serviced when repeatedly requested (and once not even then) and everything seemed to be too much trouble for the front desk. The internet connection was up and down more times then Madonnaâ€™s draws and if you used the great internet cafe next door to get on line the hotel would not reimburse the cost, even though only a few dollars. We arrived late, due to cancelled air flight and although the room had already been pre-booked and paid for, I was advised that it had been given up to some one else and I would not even get a refund, even though the hotel were getting a double whammy. After some discussion, we were eventually given a king size suite, that was little more than a large cupboard with a bed in, plus bathroom on suite and was very, very noisy. I noticed the other bedrooms that were classed as Queen Size - don't think so and no windows on the ones I saw either. The overall cost was not cheap averaging at circa. $270/night. We are experienced travellers, not just in Americaâ€™s, but throughout, Europe, Africa, Middle East and Asia Pacifica, so with considered opinion can fairly state it compares very poorly with USA major cities facilities and service as a whole. So to sum up, if you don't mind paying the price for the central location and you only need a place to sleep its OK, but there is no real guest facilities, bar, restaurant or kids area etc. in the place, so lacks any guest mingling points and real soul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Price, Closet Sized Room, Water Problems, Elevator Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, 49th St. near 7th Ave. is an incredible location. Near Times Square, the Theaters, Subway Stations, Dining and Nightlife. I would highly recommend staying here if location is your main goal. Also, great location for the price when compared to anything else in Manhattan. Unless you want to stay in New Jersey, you won't find anything this reasonable and this descent. NOW, there are some things you have to give up to stay here. One entire morning there was no hot water. A guest was complaining about it at the front desk when I was checking out and it wasn't too great for me either! I had read another reviewer of this hotel that had the same problem. Additionaly, the elevator was out a few times during my 3 nt stay. I had to walk up and down 6 flights of stairs a couple of times! Be sure not to come with more than one other person because only 2 people fit in the elevator when it is working. The room was the smallest I've ever been in anywhere. It was clean, the bathroom was great, but unless you're actually physcially in the bed, you can hardly even be in the room!
