I heard the tv from the room behind me, so not sure how well the room is insulated. Maybe I should've stayed in the bathroom during my stay. Very nice bathroom and just a little smaller than the actual bedroom. To recap, great location, great price for the location and cleanliness, very small, some problems with the elevator and water.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location with the Mayfair.”
Reviews.Author: Gusman
Reviews.Content: As long as you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room, I would highly recommend the Mayfair New York. Great, friendly staff, clean comfortable room, and outstnading value for such an incredible location!! A block off Times Square & Broadway, next door to the Eugene O'Neil Theater. Yes, the room was small, but not claustrophobic. My wife and I wanted a clean, comfortable, quiet place, centrally located in Manhattan. That's exactly what we got at the Mayfair. We spent most of our time seeing the sites, taking in shows, etc... Not in the room. . Unless you're used to 5 star hotels, I think most people would be quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, homey, charming - Mayfair New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frenda
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small, charming, boutique type hotel in a good location in Manhattan and was so pleased to find the Mayfair for our stay from Oct 6 to 10, 2005. Location is perfect at 49th Ave between 7th and 8th, just off Broadway. Times Squares is a few blocks away, not far from Rockefeller Center. Hotel is very homey. The building is close to 100 years old but is well decorated, does not smell, has high ceilings, is very clean. The hallways are narrow but well lit and clean. The room is great - we had a king bed, there's a large oversized chair in the room that converts to a single pull-out bed, the wooden windows open for fresh air, the room has a computer with free internet service and a printer, lots of closet and cupboard space to put things away. The air conditioner is quiet and has a remote control. The bathroom is awesome - large green ceramic tiles from floor to ceiling, white pedestal sink, glassed-in tub, opening windows, lots of lights. We could not hear guests in the adjoining room. Cable TV channels go on forever. Staff were friendly and helpful when needed. If you're picking up or dropping off a Budget Rent A Car vehicle, you can do so a 1/2 block away on 49th. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a homey, well located, small hotel in the heart of Manhattan. In my opinion, their website doesn't do the place justice but you can find them at mayfairnewyork.com

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Very Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, after weeks of trying to get a hotel in New York City for under $200 a night- I stumbled on The Mayfair Hotel on Travelocity for $191.00 a night. I was thrilled to find it!! I stayed from 10\23-10\26. I had read many, many reviews of the Mayfair on "tripadvisor" and needless to say that I was a little concerned with the very mixed reviews that the hotel got form other people. First off, there were 3 of us staying in one room. All in our late (very late!!) twenties, and all of us are very well traveled. Our room had only one double bed. (Each of us took a turn sleeping on the floor, on top af a stack of blankets). The room was very clean, but as others on this site will say it was very small. Approx. 10 x 10. But, the bathroom was huge (we kept all of our suitcases in the bathroom). We were in room 502. The decor of the room was pink toile. I felt like we were staying in a European boutique hotel. This is a no-frills hotel, with the smallest elevator I have ever seen. Even the hallways are narrow. But, if you are like us- all we were in New York to do was shop and sight-see, This is a great place to stay. The location was perfect!! Smack in the middle of Times Square, only 2 blocks from the subway. For me, I guess 3 things were important: Location, price, and cleanliness. The Mayfair exceeded my expectations on each on these 3 things and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable conditions - ie, no hot water for over 24 hours”
Reviews.Author: kathismom
Reviews.Content: Things that were wrong/bad about this hotel: 1) windows were dirty on the outside, didn't look like they or or the screens had been washed in years. As a matter of fact if you want reply here with your email and I'll let you know my room number - I bet our initials are still there on the outside of the window 2) Bathroom tub was not cleaned daily and had mildew growing in it. I know this because my daughter took a shower on Sat and when I went to turn on water on Sunday her hair was still in the drain. 3) light above tub/shower had tons of dead bugs in it an another light in the bathroom had no finishing/cover on it. 4) BIGGEST ISSUE - The hot water heater went out on Sat sometime as when I went to take a shower on Sunday/wash face there was NO hot water. There was a note downstairs posted about the hot water plant being out of service or broken. Come to find out it was the HOTEL's hot water heater. This was still not fixed by Sunday evening and the ET of repair was not until after 10 a.m. on Monday a.m. This is and was unacceptable. In my opinion, if your frigging hot water heater breaks even on a Sunday instead of waiting for a part, you replace the entire thing and get your paying customers their hot water OR refund at least half of their nightly rate. This was not done or offered. 5) only ice was located downstairs and had to be fetched by employees. Semi-good things: 1) free dsl and computer in room. 2) bed was nice - we had the King room and their was enough room for us two but I did see the other rooms and they were very, very, very small. 3) location. Would I stay here again? Nope. For the money I could have stayed someplace with higher standards. Come on.. a hotel with no hot water for their guests? For longer than 24 hours?? YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JTNL
Reviews.Content: The travel agency booked this hotel last minute because all other hotels were booked out and its location was close to where I had my meeting. The location is great but the US$ 233 plus taxes that I paid, was in my view too much. The reception staff is nice and helpful. There was confusion on my check in, but the lady at the front desk did het best and finally found my reservation. My room was on the 5th floor. There is a very small elevator, one only, and you may have to wait long. The room is very small indeed, I think about 3 by 3 meters (10 by 10 feet), maybe even less. It had a view on nothing. The bed was OK and the linens clean. There is an old air conditioner above the window that sounds like it is struggling to survive its own long history. This is a point in general for many American hotels: why do they use these old fashioned noisy air conditioners? In S.E. Asia they seem to be light years ahead. The hotel's own website says "intimate" rooms, which seems to mean: miniature; and "European" seems to mean: poorly maintained. The bathroom: a very small shower corner, a toilet and no room to put your toilettries because it's all post stamp size. The cover caps of the faucets were still loose on the sink. I guess the maintenance people forgot to finish their work after lunch? One of the electric outlets in the wall was hanging half loose. The wall paper may be described as "European" style decoration, but it looked very cheap and I found nothing European about it. I can't say the room was dirty, but the overall impression is simply a bit run down. There is supposed to be a place where they serve breakfast. But people were busy at the front desk, and I was a bit in a hurry, and I saw nothing that looked like a place where breakfast is served. Some postings talk positively about the decoration with all the pictures of broadway stars. They are there, but don't make the hotel a special place. Over all I was disappointed. I know: my booking was last minute through the travel agency; I believed this hotel was more or less same standard as my original choice, so I accepted the price. But I can't help feeling it is overpaid. There have been postings about problems with too high charges on the bill, but I did not experience any dishonesty like that. The staff seemed OK. If you don't mind paying this much for just a bed and a shower in an admittedly fantastic location, then this place may be acceptable for you. But don't let the "intimacy" and "European style" descriptions on the hotel's own web-site convince you; if you want a reasonably convenient room you may consider a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the Mayfair New York was the quaintest little hotel. We found it very late on a saturday night when no one else had available rooms. The man at the front desk was very accomodating. He let the three of us stay in a single room, and even went so far as to get us an extra futon mattress. Since it was so late (around 4am on sunday morning), he checked us in as sunday morning so we wouldn't have to check out until monday at noon (thereby getting two nights for the price of one). Our room was very small, but it was clean and comfortable. We had plenty of clean sheets, extra blankets and pillows, cable tv, air conditioning, and a clean bathroom with a fairly large shower. We slept in on sunday and no one bothered us, it was very quiet, and the curtains were very effective at keeping the room dark. Our room was on the top floor, and there was a very sturdy fire escape right outside the window that allowed us to climb up one level to the roof and look out over 49th and Broadway (shh don't tell). Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was very affordable as well, our room was $90 + tax for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet office Staff, Awful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SteveTampa_Fla
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed 4 days for Business, the Hotel was simply awful, except for the exceptionally kind office staff. They are so decent. The Hotel should be called "The Filthy Carpet" vs. the Mayfair. It is simply a dump. Complete with Urine stains on the seating area of the tiny room. The carpets were so filthy, that one dares not walk barefoot on the floors. I rubbed a white sock across the floor to confirm my suspicion and the sock came out black. Whats most disturbing is the management, as innkeepers, have no pride in the accommodations that charge in excess of $200 per night. What is it all coming to? And right next door is the Days Inn which is usually known as a very poor hotel choice, and which at this second under total rennovation. Readers and I should be careful and truly read the reviews of current visitors of the Mayfair as the reviews are certainly correct. The best part of staying at the Mayfair is that you will wish to stay out late at night and see all of NY so as not to return to your room. You never want to return to that room.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine but expensive......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed here after having had to move from our hotel due to a mouse. We got it at very short notice and paid premium price for the privilage. It was very basic, very small rooms. staff were plesent enough and seemed to have a good bater amongst them. Our flight was in the afternoon of the morning we checked out and we were charged two dollors for each bag to keep them for the day i thought this was very excessive and money grabbing.

Reviews.Title: “Many Happy Returns! ;-)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In contrast to some of the other reviews, I think Mayfair New York has a great location and is a fantastic value. In fact, I've returned to stay at the Mayfair about a dozen times during the past six years! I travel to New York on business frequently, and have stayed at quite a few of the more affordable hotels in the Theater District. I've stayed at probably 20+ hotels in midtown Manhattan on both the East and West sides. My favorite of all of them in terms of value is Mayfair New York. It's true that many of the rooms are small (some are outright cramped), and the hotel doesn't have internet. However, the Double Deluxe rooms (not listed on their web site) are great for one person, and the King rooms are great for couples. There is also an internet cafe next door to the hotel that has reasonable rates for WiFi (less than $10/day). The hotel is clean, and I like the many old black & white photographs of movie and theater personalities from bygone days. The slow elevator doesn't both me, since I prefer to walk up and down stairs (I usually stay on the sixth or seventh floor). I've had nothing but positive experiences in dealing with the staff at the Mayfair. One reassuring thing to note is that the staff seems happy and I've seen relatively little turnover during the past six years. A nice personal touch is that some of the staff remembers me when I arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small (as expected) and the air conditioning is very noisy and old. It is expensive at Â£70 a night per single room but the location is what you pay for. However, they overcharged me by $300 and are still yet to refund me the full amount. No explanation, no apology, no communication at all. Be very careful as to what they are charging you. If anyone from the Hotel actually cares please contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair - not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mayfair is in terrible shape, the rooms are small, nothing is maintained. Service was horrible. Obviously it is WAY overpriced. Its location is the only positive. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Mayfair”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After I had made reservations at the Mayfair, someone told me about the Trip Advisor website. I checked out the Mayfair and was somewhat dismayed. It was, however, too late to find another hotel. My husband and I approached the Mayfair with some trepidation. What we found was a friendly and helpful young woman from Belgium at the desk, a bellhop who took over our luggage and got it to our comfortable room. Yes, the king- sized bed took up a lot of the room but it was comfortable. The room was clean and well appointed. Our window looked out on a dark area where the fire escape was. It was a good location because it was very quiet. No traffic noise. The elevator was small but adequate. The air conditioner wasn't working. We called the desk and a young man appeared and fixed the problem within fifteen minutes. The hotel is located a half block off Broadway--great! I'm not sure why so many people seem to have had a bad experience. Maybe they weren't expecting a small NYC hotel. My husband and I would absolutely stay at this hotel when in NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Disputing Charge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the day after Thanksgiving, 2004. I bought through Hotwire. It reminded me of a little Paris Hotel I stayed in. Small Lobby... some character. But the room was incredibly small. The smallest I've ever stayed in. The Bathroom actually had a bi-fold door and the bed was an odd-sized twin and a half---not a full size as Hotwire promises as a minimum. The worst thing, though, is the hotel processed a charge on my VISA of $115. Everyone takes a card for "incidentals" and I had pre-paid through the blind sight. But I had no charges whatsoever. The hotel produced a sales slip (unsigned) so I had to close and re-open my credit card account and now sign an affadavit. Too much trouble. Even without the credit card trouble, the room was just too tiny.

HotelInfo.Name: Mayfair Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 242 West 49th Street, New York City, NY 10019
